loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 43 años de edad que debido a la zona donde vivió su niñez sus padres de escasos recursos económicos no pudieron apoyarla en sus estudios solo pudo cursar el segundo grado de la primaria. Desde su niñez por influencia de sus padres se ha dedicado al cultivo de café ya que en su familia es una tradición y su único medio de ingreso económico. De su matrimonio tienen 3 hijos con ellos viven una hija de 17 años está estudiando en secundaria, la segunda de 12 años la cual también está en secundaria y la hija mayor que está en hogar a parte. Sus 2 hijas que aún viven con ella ayudan con el cultivo de café como ser: limpia, abona, y corta de la cosecha. La tierra que en familia cultivan es obtenida por el esfuerzo propio por lo que han trabajado juntos su esposo y sus hijas para así tener una mejor calidad de vida. La tierra donde cultivan está a una distancia de 20 metros de su casa de habitación a la que se trasladan a pie diariamente. 

María está solicitando un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de fertilizante y abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. 

Su sueño es poder incrementar sus cultivos de café, ser los mejores productores de la zona para obtener mejores ingresos y de esa forma también mejorar la vida de sus hijas en el estudio y en otros aspectos que son necesarios para su crecimiento y conocimiento.
texts.en:
María, 43, is a woman who because of the zone she spent her childhood in and because of her parents’ limited economic resources was unable to go to school; she only completed second grade in primary school.  Since childhood and because of her parents’ influence she’s worked growing coffee since that’s the family tradition and her only source of income.

Her marriage produced three children.  A 17-year-old daughter who is attending secondary school and a 12-year-old daughter who is also in secondary school still live with her; her eldest daughter lives in a separate home.  Her two daughters still living with her help with the coffee growing; weeding, feeding and picking the beans.   The land they farm on was acquired through their own efforts; her husband, her daughters and she have worked together to have better quality of life.  The land they work is 20 meters from home and they walk to it daily.

María is asking for a Comixmul loan to buy fertilizer and manure to provide maintenance for her coffee crop.  Her dream is to be able to increase her coffee crops, to be the best producers in the zone and to earn higher income in order to also improve their daughters’ lives by means of schooling and other aspects necessary for their growth and learning.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela, de 22 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su hija en la casa de sus padres. Como buena madre de familia, soltera y joven tiene muchas ambiciones, una de ellas es poder culminar sus estudios de enfermería, “deseo ser una profesional y poder enseñar todo lo necesario a mi hija para que triunfe en la vida”, afirma. Ella se esfuerza mucho pues su trabajo, estudio y el cuidado de su hija no le permiten tener mucho tiempo libre, pero ello no le molesta pues sabe que muy pronto tendrá la recompensa. Su principal ingreso económico es la crianza de animales como vacas, cuyes , cerdos y gallinas. Para su buena alimentación ella misma siembra el pasto que comerán y compra comida balanceada. Esto le ayuda a tener buenos animales, los cuales vende a un buen precio entre los comerciantes que llegan a su casa cada fin de semana.   
Pamela, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de alfalfa el cual le sirve de alimentos para sus animales.
texts.en:
Pamela, 22, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her daughter in her parents’ house.  Like all good single, young mothers she has many ambitions.  One of them is to complete her nursing studies.  “I want to become a professional and to be able to teach my daughter everything needed so she can be successful in life,” she affirms.  She puts in quite an effort because work, school and caring for her daughter does not leave her much free time left but this doesn’t bother her because she knows that she’ll be rewarded soon.  

Her main source of income is raising animals like cows, guinea pigs, pigs and chickens.  She herself grows the grasses they will eat so that their feeding will be good; she also buys nutritionally balanced feed.  This helps her to have good animals that she sells at good prices to merchants that come by her house every weekend.  Pamela will use the 1,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her alfalfa crops that she uses as animal feed.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Tovshingal

texts.en:
Mrs.Tovshingal is a 35-year-old single mother. She lives with her three children in Ger in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her three children are between the ages of 2 and 12 and all attend local schools and kindergarten. 

Tovshingal has been providing tailoring services at home since 2006 while she took care of her children. She is a hardworking, optimistic, and diligent woman who wants to raise her children to be highly educated. She is now requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to purchase tailoring inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring inventory for her business

loans.name: Edy

texts.es:
Edy de 36 años es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 18 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, juntos viven en su casa propia. Edy se dedica a elaborar pasteles, anteriormente trabajaba en una pastelería muy concurrida de la ciudad pero hace poco abrió su propia panaderia en una ciudad aledaña, pues considera que el mercado esta copado. Ahora desea mejorar su negocio para así incrementar sus ingresos.Este es su cuarto crédito y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante , por está razón se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Edy, invertirá el dinero en la compra de sacos de harina para la elaboración de sus ricos pasteles.
texts.en:
Edy, 36, is a single mother of two children who are 18 and 21 years of age respectively; they all live together in a house of their own.  Edy works baking cakes.  She used to work in a very busy bakery in the city but recently opened her own bakery in an adjacent city because she felt the market was saturated.  Now, she wants to improve the business in order to increase her income.

This is her 4th loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue moving forward.  Because of this she commits to make her payments punctually.  Edy will use the money to buy sacks of flour to make her delicious cakes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es: Ana María es una mujer de 31 años de edad, es soltera y madre de un hijo de 4 años. Actualmente tiene una sala de belleza ubicada en su casa, aunque también presta el servicio a domicilio y en horarios flexibles de acuerdo a los requerimientos de sus clientes. Ana María es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, cuando salió del colegio se capacitó y comenzó a laborar en salas de belleza y peluquerías, pero finalmente decidió independizarse luego de haber obtenido la experiencia en este campo. Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar insumos y productos de belleza (maquillaje, tintes, tratamientos capilares, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), con el fin de tener disponibilidad suficiente para continuar desarrollando su actividad y, de esta manera atraer más clientes que le generen ingresos para continuar con el sostenimiento de su hogar. Su mayor deseo es hacer crecer su negocio, en el que pueda mezclar varios servicios como spa, sala de belleza, maquillaje permanente, entre otros; mejorar su calidad de vida y así poder ofrecer más oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Ana María, 31, is single and the mother of a 4-year-old son.  She currently has a beauty salon located at home although she also provides services in customers’ homes on a flexible schedule according to their needs.  Ana María is an enterprising, hardworking woman.  When she got out of high school she trained and started working in beauty salons and barber shops but finally decided to become independent once she acquired experience in this field.

She intends to use the loan she’s requesting to buy supplies and beauty products (make-up, hair color, hair treatments, nail polish, etc.) in order to have enough on hand to continue doing her work and thus attracting more customers that will generate income to continue supporting her home.  Her greatest wish is to make the business grow so she can combine various services like spa, beauty salon, permanent make-up, among others and to improve her quality of life in order to be able to offer more employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en:
Intisar is a 55-year-old widow who has to work hard in order to make her living. Intisar is a Palestinian refugee who lives and has her clothes and accessories shop in a Palestinian Camp, which she hardly leaves to go anywhere else.

Intisar is applying for her fifth cycle loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her accessories and perfumes inventory with a newly released collection. Al Majmoua supports Intisar a lot, since she works hard to improve her living.

She hopes that one day she can be able to buy her own shop instead of paying part of her net income for rent.

loans.use: To purchase more accessories and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace water pipes at home.

loans.name: Yumdermaa

texts.en:
Mrs.Yumdermaa is 50 years old and lives with her five children in Ger, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her oldest son got married and moved out. Her older children have graduated and started working. Her three younger children are still attending schools. 

Yumdermaa has been running a cafeteria in town for years. She has built a regular client base and close relationship with her suppliers. She is now requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a secondhand car for her son, to start a taxi service business in town. She is a hardworking, caring, and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car for her son, to start a taxi service business in town

loans.name: Gerlee

texts.en:
Mrs. Gerlee is 34 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ger, in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband Tuvdenjamts works at a local company as an assistant worker. Gerlee gave birth to their daughter Nomin a year ago and has stayed home take care of her daughter and husband since then. 

She is now starting a small grocery store business in a rental place. She used to work at a grocery store for years before this and has a lot of experience in the business. She is now requesting 6,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory and cover monthly rent. She is a hardworking, optimistic, and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory and cover monthly rent

loans.name: Tuvshinbat

texts.en: Mr.Tuvshinbat is 23 years old and lives with his father in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His father has been running a photography service business in town since 2007. He used to help his father and he learned so much from his father. He has been operating the photography business with his father recently but he lost his camera and his business temporarily stopped. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a new camera to continue providing his photography service business in his rented place. He is a hardworking, talented and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase a new camera

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Eduardo es originario de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, tiene 31 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Mireya Guadalupe, con quien tiene tres hijos de edad escolar dos en la primaria y un en preescolar. 
Están solicitando un préstamo para cambiar la tubería de agua en toda la casa ya que actualmente esta en malas condiciones,  pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
El señor Jorge Eduardo es empleado de una compañía de trasportes como chofer de un camión de carretera, su esposa se dedica al cuidado y atención de sus hijos.
Con una parte del sueldo del señor Jorge Eduardo es para pagar el crédito ya que es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene para salir adelante.
Desean mejorar el patrimonio de sus hijos y que tengan un lugar seguro y con las comodidades necesaria para su vida.
texts.en:
Jorge Eduardo is from the city of Nuevo Laredo.  He’s 31-years-old and married to Mireya Guadalupe with whom he has three school age children, two in elementary school and a preschooler.

They are requesting a loan to replace the water pipes in the entire house because they are in bad condition but he does not have the money needed to buy the materials and to pay the person who will do the work.  

Jorge Eduardo works for a transportation firm as a truck driver and his wife cares for the children.  Jorge Eduardo will use part of his salary to repay the loan since this is his only source of income.  They hope to improve their children’s estate and that they have a safe, comfortable place to live in.

loans.use: to replace his home's water pipes.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia, de 51 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia. Teodosia se dedica a la agricultura pues sus terrenos estan ubicados en una zona muy fértil, donde ella siembra maíz, papa, entre otros. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues obtiene muy buenos ingresos. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus alimentos ya que así tedran mayor demanda. “Este año espero sacar una buena cosecha de papa”, afirma. Ahora desea concentrar todo su tiempo en la agricultura y en su pequeña tienda de comestibles. Este es su cuarto préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
Teodocia, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Teodocia is 51, married and has two daughters who she lives with in their own house. Teodocia works in agriculture since her land is located in a very fertile area, where she grows corn and potatoes among other things. She likes her work a lot as she earns a very good income. 

Now she wants to improve the quality of her crops because then she will have a greater demand. "This year I hope to get a good potato harvest", she affirms. Now she wants to concentrate all her time on agriculture and her little grocery shop. 

This is her fourth loan with KIVA and she feels very grateful for the financial support she has received. What's more, she promises to pay back her installments on time. 

Teodocia will invest 1500 Soles in buying organic fertilizer to nourish her potato fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is 19 years old. He is the brother of four siblings, one of whom is already married. Ahmed goes to a public university in Southern Jordan; he is working on a bachelor's degree in chemistry. Today he is seeking a loan that will help him pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Las Guerreras Group

texts.es:
Don Lorenzo es integrante de un grupo llamado Las Guerreras, y le decidieron este nombre a grupo porque la mayoría de sus integrantes son mujeres y todas luchan como Guerreras por sacar adelante a sus familias a través de sus negocios y actividades económicas.Este grupo está ubicado en Tres Valles donde las principales actividades son el comercio y la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar y piña.
Don Lorenzo tiene 47 años de edad, solo tiene estudios de secundaria y es soltero, él platica que por más de 10 años se ha dedicado a la venta de masa y su actividad la realiza con la ayuda de su motocicleta. Todos los días, don Lorenzo se levanta muy temprano para iniciar a moler su nixtamal, después lo empaca en bolsas por kilos y  kilo y ½ kilos para posteriormente con la ayuda de su moto salir a las calles a entregar los pedidos y a vender el resto de su masa. En su comunidad ya es muy conocido y cuando pasa por las calles las señoras salen a comprarles.

Lo que más le gusta de sus actividades es que ha hecho buenas amistades y gana su propio dinero.
Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudará a comprar 1 tonelada de Maíz para continuar con su actividad.
El está muy contento son su actividad ya que le ha dado un trabajo y la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.

A futuro espera que su negocio crezca y obtener más ganancias.
“Gracias por el préstamo que me da la oportunidad de trabajar invirtiendo en los negocio de ahí vamos sacando para nuestros pagos y para comer”.
Los demás integrantes de este grupo son:
Juana-Venta de refrescos.
Sotera Maribel-Reparación de calzado.
Daria- Venta de Queso
Hortencia-Farmacia
Margarita-Venta de Guaraches y servicio de Volteo
Yulma-Venta de cosméticos
María Esther- Venta de refrescos y hielitos
María Concepción-Venta de abarrotes
María Josefa-Venta de tacos.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a member of the group called Las Guerreras (The Warriors). They decided on this name for the group because the majority of their members are women and all of them fight like warriors to get their families ahead through their business and economic activities. This group is located in Tres Valles where the main activities are trade and growing sugar cane and pineapple. 

Lorenzo is 47 years old, he only finished secondary school and he is single. He says that for more than 10 years he has worked selling dough and he does this with the help of his motorcycle. Everyday, Lorenzo gets up very early to start grinding his boiled corn. Afterwards he packs it into kilo and kilo and a half bags to later, with the help of his motorcycle, go out onto the streets to deliver his orders and sell the rest of his dough. 

He is very well-known in his community and when he passes by, the women come out to buy. What he likes most about his business is that he has made good friends and he earns his own money. 

A loan from VisionFund will help him to buy a tonne of corn to continue his business. He is very happy with his business because it has given him a job and the opportunity to have a better quality of life. 

In the future he hopes his business grows and he earns more profits. "Thank you for the loan, which gives me the opportunity to work investing in the business - from it we are taking money for our pay and to eat".

The other members of this group are:
Juana - selling soft drinks
Sotera Maribel - repairing footwear
Daria - selling cheese
Hortencia - pharmacy
Margarita - selling Guaraches (a type of rough leather sandal) y hauling services
Yulma - selling cosmetics
María Esther - selling soft drinks and hielitos
María Concepción - selling groceries
María Josefa - selling tacos

loans.use: to buy a tonne of corn

loans.name: Ingrid Indira

texts.es:
Ingrid, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y su esposo tiene 30 años de edad, disfruta de un hijo, el cual tiene cuatro años. Ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa y ya lleva dos años de poseerlo, lo realiza de lunes a sábado, el oficio lo aprendió con una hermana, la ventaja con la que cuenta es que esta en un lugar donde se vende bastante.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para ofrecerle a sus clientes; esta compra le ayudara a obtener más ingresos e incrementar su inventario.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ingrid, 26, is married and her husband is 30-years-old. She enjoys her four-year-old son.  She works selling clothes and has been doing so for two years.  She works Monday to Saturday and she learned the occupation from her sister.  The advantage she has is that she’s in a place where sales are good.

She needs the loan to buy clothes to offer her customers; this purchase will help her earn higher income and increase her inventory.  Her dream is to provide better quality of life for her family and to strengthen the business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta es madre soltera de 5 hijos con un grado de educación primario no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado ya que sus padres no pudieron apoyarla por la falta de apoyo económico hacia ella. En su compañía solo viven 3 de sus 5 hijos los cuales le ayudan con las diferentes actividades en el campo como ser: corte, abono y limpieza del cultivo. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en este rubro como lo es la agricultura ya que desde muy joven fueron sus padres los que le inculcaron esta actividad ya que en su familia es tradición. El ingreso económico que ella obtiene es por medio del café, la venta de banano y plátano. La tierra que ella en compañía de sus hijos trabaja es propia ya que es una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está ubicada a una distancia de 1 kilómetro de su casa de habitación.

En la actualidad doña Marta ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para poder dar una mejor asistencia y mantenimiento a su plantación de café ya que es necesario para poder obtener una excelente cosecha.

Su sueño como madre es ver a sus hijos crecer y en mejores condiciones de vida con un patrimonio favorable en el futuro capaz de poder dar los frutos necesarios para poder enfrentar los problemas económicos de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Marta is a single mother of five children; she did not complete primary school, she only got to third grade because her parents did not have the economic wherewithal to pay for more schooling for her.  Only three of her five children still live with her and they help out with the various field chores like cutting, feeding and weeding.  She has much experience in this line of agricultural work because her parents taught it to her when she was still very young since it’s the family tradition. The income she earns is through coffee, banana and plantain sales.  The land she and her children work is hers; she inherited it from her parents and it’s located one kilometer away from home.

At present, Marta has requested a Comixmul loan to provide better care for her coffee crop because it’s necessary in order to obtain an excellent harvest.  Her dream as a mother is to see her children grow in better living conditions with a favorable estate for the future that’s capable of producing the necessary fruits so they can face economic problems in a favorable way.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for coffee crop care.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María, de 62 años, tiene 4 hijos pero ahora vive sola en su casa propia.Maria posee una pastelería muy elegante y concurrida en su ciudad, además tiene varias sedes en pueblos cercanos. María administra una de las pastelerías. “Me va muy bien pues ya tengo conocimiento de este negocio, mi meta es que crezca mucho más y llegar a ser uno de los mejores”, afirma. Es así que trabaja día a día para poder lograr su meta y por ello necesita de capital de trabajo para superar sus expectativas. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
María, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los pasteles tales como harina, matequilla, azúcar, entre otros.
texts.en:
María, 62, has four children but she currently lives alone in her own house.  María owns a very elegant, busy pastry shop in her city and also has several branches in nearby towns.  María manages one of the pastry shops.  “I do very well because I already know this business.  My goal is that it grows much more and becomes one of the best,” she affirms.  This is how she works day to day to reach her goal and to do so she needs working capital to meet her expectations.  

This is her first Kiva loan so she commits to be punctual with her monthly payments.  María will use the 1,000 soles to buy ingredients for her cakes such as flour, butter and sugar, among others.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Nella

texts.es: Nella de 31 años de edad, está casada con David , ambos tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en la casa que alquilo hace 2 años. Ella posee una casa propia, pero por su negocio alquilaron una casa cerca de la plaza de su ciudad y así poder abrir una panadería. Comenta que su trabajo es muy rentable pues es una de las pocas personas que elabora este producto. Se levanta muy temprano para poder elaborar sus panes y así poder obtener muy buenos ingresos. Ahora desea comprar máquinas industriales para poder mejorar sus productos y de esa manera reducir tiempo y esfuerzo, pues ella lo realiza de manera manual y artesanal. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero recibido ya que esto le permitira mejorar sus ingresos. Además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Nella, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de harina al por mayor.
texts.en:
Nella, 31, is married to David; they have four children living with them in the house she rented two years ago.  She owns a house but because of the business they leased a house near the city’s square in order to open a bakery.  She comments that her work is very profitable because she’s one of the few people making this product.  She rises very early in order to make the bread and earn very good income.

Now, she’d like to buy industrial machinery to improve her products and reduce the time and effort because she currently works by hand in an artisanal way.

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the financial support received because it will allow her to improve her income.  She commits to be punctual with her installment payments.  Nella will use the 1,000 soles to buy flour at wholesales.

loans.use: to buy flour at wholesale.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.en: Marie Therese is 40 years old. She is a mother of four children, all of whom are in school. Marie Therese sells sodas and juices in a canteen which she has been running for the past ten years. With the loan she has requested, she would like to buy more sodas and juices for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sodas and juices for sale.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Julio is an enterprising man who is 48 years old, married and lives with his wife.  He is requesting a loan with the desire of purchasing supplies like fertilizers and pesticides.  He wants to care for his coffee crops with the aim of maintaining them in good condition during their development in order to obtain a good quality product.  The only limitation that this gentleman has is the lack of money to continue growing as they depend on this economic activity in order to be able to get ahead.  That is why he is making a request for a loan and it is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other loans from state banks before but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Tito Salvador

texts.es:
Tito, tiene 35 años de edad, está casado y su compañera  de vida tiene 30 años de edad, disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 2 y 7 años. Don Tito, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene dos años de poseer el negocio y lo desempeña de lunes a sábado, este oficio lo aprendió con una tía desde niño.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar variedad de ropa; esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su inventario y así obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es fortalecer su negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Tito, 35, is married and his spouse is 30-years-old; he enjoys two children who are 2 and 7 years of age.  Tito works selling clothes; he’s had the business for two years and he works Monday to Saturday.  He learned the business from his aunt when he was a boy. 

The loan he needs will make it possible for him to buy an assortment of clothes; this investment will help him increase his inventory thus earning higher income.  His dream is to strengthen the business and to offer better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothes.

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois is 22 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Lois is single. She completed grade 12 prior to establishing her business seven years ago. Her business involves selling cosmetics such as body cream, bath soap, body spray, roll-ons, etc. She started this business with a little amount from her mother and she learned this business from her. She likes how people respond to her business and mostly enjoys the interaction with her customers. She spends eight hours with her business, six day a week. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics such as body cream, bath soap, body spray, roll-ons, etc. for her business. She hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics such as body cream, bath soap, body spray, roll-ons, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Mary is married. She did not go to school. She has eight children between 32 and 16 years old, only one of whom is in school and living at home. For the past four years, she has been selling pepper, rice, milk etc. She started this business with a little amount from her husband and she learned this business from her mother. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it and she spends eight hours on her business six days a week. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, milk etc for her business and hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, milk etc for her business,

loans.name: Bano

texts.en: Bano is 44 years old, married and a mother of four children. She has been actively involved in the business of making handmade fancy bangles for the last 10 years. She purchases dozens of plain bangles and after embellishing them with stones and pearls, sells them to the people of her community. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. She wants to grow her business and requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy dozens of bangles in various sizes and colors with some packs of pearls and stones for embellishment. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy dozens of bangles in various sizes and colors, packs of pearls and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 32 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County (Liberia), located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Louise is married; she did not go to school and has seven children whose ages she does not know, only three of whom are in school and live at home. For the past five years Louise has been selling medicine in a shop. She started this business with a small amount of money from her husband, and she learned the business from her mother. She likes her business because of the ways people buy from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more paracetamol, quinine, etc. for her business. She hopes to earn more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more paracetamol, quinine, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: Nour is a 20-year-old single woman. She is a sister of eight siblings. Nour goes to college to get a degree. She knows that it is difficult on her family to support so many people, but she insists on continuing her studies. For this reason, Nour is now seeking a loan to help her pay for the next semester's registration fees.

loans.use: pay for the next semester's registration fees.

loans.name: Afifa

texts.en:
Afifa is a 50-year-old married woman, mother of four children, who has been working in clothing sales for 20 years. Through visiting neighbors, friends and relatives, and selling her products (with the help of a previous Kiva loan), Afifa was able to open and expand her own clothes selling shop, which is an excellent step forward towards developing her business and improving her family's lives.

She is very proud of herself and the step she took forward; it really lessened the family's burden. Afifa's positive action includes the fact that her shop is located in a densely populated area with different nationalities, which provides her with different cultures, tastes, and needs. Afifa has to update her business to attract different visitors every day. Her loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua will be invested in acquiring a new summer collection.

Afifa hopes to open a new business in the near future.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a special summer collection

loans.name: Saad Eddine

texts.en:
Saad Eddine is a 34-year-old married man, father of two children. He has been working in auto repair, specializing in electrical work since 2008. 

Saad Eddine is applying for his sixth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to register his car, which is very important for his work, since he can use it to go and serve a client in need and to buy necessary tools and spare parts for his business. Saad Eddine's previous loans helped him a lot in increasing his business capital and his revenue, which has had a very positive impact on his socioeconomic situation. Saad Eddine is working hard to keep expanding his business and increasing his income.

loans.use: To register his car and buy tools and spare parts necessary for his business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is 27 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She is married. She completed seventh grade and has three children between eight and three years old. They are  in school and  live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling local soap and red oil in the local market. She started this business with a little amount from her husband and she learned this business from her mother. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it and she spends eight hours on her business six days a week She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap and red oil for her business. She hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more soap and red oil for her business,

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de arroz, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Luis is an enterprising man who is 39 years old, married and lives with his wife.  He is requesting a loan with the desire of purchasing supplies like fertilizers.  He wants to care for his rice crops with the aim of maintaining them in good condition during their development in order to obtain a good quality product.  The only limitation that this gentleman has is the lack of money to continue growing as they depend on this economic activity in order to be able to get ahead.  That is why he is making a request for a loan and it is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other loans from state banks before but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting rice.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer is 34 years old and married. Her husband works at a furniture-making company as an installer. Abeer, on the other hand, works in a tailoring business at her house. She takes special orders to make clothes and curtains. Now she has a big order that she needs to work on but she lacks the finances to buy the fabric. For that reason, she is applying for this loan to buy the requested fabric and start the making process to deliver it on time.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics

loans.name: Odai

texts.en: Odai is a 21-year-old single guy, the oldest brother to four siblings. He is a second-year university student majoring in accounting and also works in a restaurant to cover some of his expenses. Odai is applying for a loan to help him pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 51 years old. She has a retail store and has been in this business for the past eight years. With the loan she has requested, she would like to buy more sugar and flour for sale. The profits from the increased business will be used to pay school fees and provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and flour for sale.

loans.name: Marthaline

texts.en:
Marthaline is 29 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

Marthaline is married. She did not go to school, and she has four children between 2 and 12 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past four years Marthaline has been selling fish in the local market in order to support her children. She started this business by working for her mother, and she learned the business from her. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She hopes to earn more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne is 51 years old. She sells cooking oil and sugar. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sugar to sell

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik lives in Tasik village in the Syunik region. She lives with her husband and two children: her 16-year-old son and 15-year-old daughter. They have a nice family and help each other on the farm. Their farm currently includes 10 sheep, a cow and 12 chickens. The family also owns a plot of land where potato is cultivated.
 
Knarik milks a cow and her husband sells the gathered dairy products in the local markets. Now, Knarik wants to purchase additional sheep and increase her agricultural activities. She is asking for a loan to purchase eight sheep. The loan is important for her to be able to enlarge her farm and make it profitable. 

Knarik is a very hardworking woman who does her best to give her children all they need. This loan will be a small step toward her dream of having a big and successful farming business.

Knarik waits for your support!

loans.use: to buy eight sheep

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 21-year-old single lady who is living with her six siblings and parents. Her father works in computer repair while her mother is a social researcher. Sarah now attends a public university to get her bachelor degree. She applied for this loan to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for a semester at the university

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 40 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Yassah is married and has five children between 20 and 9 years old. Only three of her children are in school, and they all live at home. For the past four years Yassah has sold juice in the local market in order to support her children. She started this business by selling for her mother, and she learned the business from her. Yassah likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more juice for her business. She hopes to earn more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more juice for her business.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 48-year-old conservative woman. She asked her daughter to take her place in the photo. Najah is a mother of four children. One of them is Fatmeh, who is a 20-year-old university student majoring in child care. Najah’s husband can’t afford to pay the whole semester's fees at once from the small salary he gets from working at a security company. For this reason, Najah decided to help by taking an educational loan to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert in his mid-30's and is married with two siblings. Gilbert's home is in the outskirts of the main town of Ibanda. 

Gilbert is a mobile, door-to-door photographer, a business he has done for over ten years. To him, this is a landmark in his life as he has managed to start a retail shop for his wife and a banana plantation. His main challenge now is lack of adequate capital to boost his retail shop. He has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from UGAFODE to buy more daily, household items for the retail shop.

loans.use: to buy retail stock items

loans.name: Azjargal

texts.en: Mrs Azjargal is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Chimedtseren, works at a construction company. Her two daughters study at a local school and her son goes to a local kindergarten. Azjargal has worked at a local shoe manufacturing company for four years and gained a lot of experience in the field. She is now planning to start her own business manufacturing shoes at home and now requests 2,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory of leather, soles and other materials for her new shoe manufacturing business. She is a hardworking, diligent and well-behaved person.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory of leather, soles and other materials

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is proud to be an Egyptian Albanian. Here is what she said to the loan officer,” I am proud of our ethnicity. Members of our community are hard-workers and authentic with a zeal for life. After the collapse of the previous regime, we were given plenty of opportunities from the Albanian government and foreign agencies also to thrive and improve our lives. So, we did; majority of us, of course. Today we have jobs and businesses that we never had and never dreamed to have. Our children go to schools now, and these are accomplishments we are proud of, today.” Rubie ended her conversation. 
Rubie is a widowed mother of three children; two of whom are still going to school. For the past 10 years, she has been selling inexpensive clothes in the streets, as you can see from the picture.  She now wants to buy summer clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy inexpensive summer clothes to resell

loans.name: Delta

texts.en:
This is Delta. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Delta dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes that the time will come that she will no longer borrow money. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
Cornelio es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y cuenta que su sueño es poder tener su propio negocio en el que pueda aplicar todo lo que aprendió por medio de su carrera.
Quien le inspira a seguir sus metas es su familia y el querer salir adelante y el día de mañana ser un gran profesional que pueda ser útil a todas las personas.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad y también para poder invertirlo en la compra de útiles para su carrera.
texts.en:
Cornelio is from the city of Caaguazú and is studying for a degree in Accounting. He dreams of having his own business so that he can apply everything he learned from his degree.

Cornelio’s family inspires him to continue with his goals. He wants to move forward and become a successful professional in the future so that he can be of use to all people. Cornelio is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his university tuition. He will also buy supplies that he needs to pursue his degree.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition and to buy supplies for his studies.

loans.name: Yulce

texts.en:
Yulce is a 49-year-old woman who has three children: Sandra, who is 27 years old and married, Ariani who is 20 years old and a college student and Army who is 18 years old and has just finished high school.

Yulce started a business selling “Nasi Kuning”, a delicious local dish made from a packet of yellow rice, an omelette, tempe/tofu, noodles and chili sauce. She started this business in 2007 with IDR 500,000 of her own money, selling the Nasi Kuning at a roadside stall from 8 am until she sells out. Her daily income is IDR 250,000 each day. However, with rising fuel prices, the cost of the ingredients for the Nasi Kuning has also risen. Yulce, therefore, is asking for an individual loan from TLM of IDR 4,000,000 to help cover the price increase of the ingredients for Nasi Kuning. Additionally, the funds will help her pay for fees associated with medical checkups for her daughter who has a heart condition.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making Nasi Kuning and to pay for medical checkups for her daughter

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. she previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 28,000 PHP loan in order for her to buy parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita dreams to expand her business and have more other source resources. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a 44 year-old single woman who lives with her sister. She started a sewing business in 1993 and learned the skills when she was a student of a vocational high school. In the beginning she sewed bible covers and pencil cases, but now she is building on her sewing skills and in the last three years she has begun sewing blouses, skirts and kebaya (a typical woman’s blouse the front of which is pinned together).

Rahab's living costs are closely tied to her income from sewing which amounts to IDR 1 000,000 each day. Her first sewing machine was purchased using her own capital which was later followed with the purchase of a new machine in 1998 with the help of the Indonesian Department of Labor.

Today, in line with the improvement of her sewing capability, she wants to buy a hemming machine but she lacks the funds to do so. Therefore, Rahab asks for a loan from Kiva partner TLM in the amount of IDR 4,000,000. She hopes that with the new hemming machine she will make the business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy an Obras sewing machine.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza is 24 years old and married with one child and some dependants. She lives in Kyotera town with her family. She also takes care of four other children who lost their parents. 

Specioza is a businesswoman who deals in secondhand clothes and she is also a farmer who deals in agriculture, specifically maize and coffee growing for additional income. She has been in the secondhand clothes business since 2009. She works seven days a week and each day she works for 14 hours. She started this business in order to increase the income for her family and to be able to pay school fees for these children. She sells her products to residents around the town where she stays
.
She has acquired this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

Her greatest dreams are opening up another outlet in Kyotera town and educating all her children to the highest levels of learning.

Like any other business, Specioza faces the challenges of high transport costs, delay of payments by her clients who take goods on credit and lack of enough capital to bring in stylish goods on time.

She describes herself as a hard working lady.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda lives in Mombasa, Kenya, together with her husband and their three children. For five years now she has been selling charcoal for a living. Her husband works with an oil company. 

She is now seeking a loan to buy 200 bags of charcoal to resell. She is determined to own a car hire company of her own and that is the motivation in doing this business. She learnt about Kiva partner Milango from a group of women friends who just joined. She joined for the purpose of saving and then a need to add stock came up and the loan idea is here now. 

There have been challenges that affected her business. She shares that transportation costs are very high and the suppliers of the commodity are unreliable. One of her children completed high school and is yet to join college. The other two are still in high school and doing this business will ensure that they get the best education. She also says that income from the loan will help her improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy 200 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46-years-old and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

Nancy and her fiancé stay together.  She stopped her education in 5th grade and she has three children aged between 30 and 13 years old , only one is in school, and lives at home.  For the past 20 years, she been selling rice, pepper, onions, oil, vita, etc in the local market in order to help her children. She  started this business  by selling for her mother, and she learned this business from her.  She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, onions, oil, vita, etc. for her business and she hopesto have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, onions, oil, vita, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en: Eyad is a 20-year-old single man and he has five siblings. Eyad goes to a public university studying nursing to be able to provide needed help for people in the future. He is now seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en: Abdulrahman is a 23-year-old single man with four siblings. Abdulrahman is a university student majoring in mathematics. He is seeking a loan today to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 55 лет. Она замужем и имеет единственного сына. Сын Фирузы женат и имеет двоих прекрасных деток. Все они живут вместе в одном большом доме. Муж Фирузы работает дехканом. Сама Фируза занимается торговлей, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на проживание. Этому делу она научилась ещё с детства. С 15 лет она вела мелкую торговлю, чтобы зарабатывать себе на расходы для школы. Она продавала мелкие продукты, но сейчас она намного расширила и стабилизировала свой бизнес. Для ведения своего бизнеса с 2011 года она неоднократно получала кредит в Арванд, что помогло ей успешно увеличить свой бизнес и прибыль, получаемую от него. На сегодня у неё имеется магазин, где она реализует свой товар. У неё также имеется широкий ассортимент продовольственного товара, это разновидность консервов, печений, макаронных изделий, чая, кофе и таких товаров как мыло, стиральные и чистящие порошки и прочие. Свой товар Фируза скупает  у поставщиков и продает у себя в районе. Также она не останавливается на достигнутом и хочет ещё больше расширить свой бизнес, так как спрос на её товар увеличивается и появляются новые нужды у населения. И для этого Фируза хочет взять кредит в Арванд, чтобы закупить больше товара и лучше обустроить свой магазин.  Она очень благодарна за финансовую поддержку организации «Арванд».
texts.en:
Firuza is a hard-working, 55-year-old woman. She is married and has one son. Firuza's son is married and has two beautiful children. They all live together in one large house. Fizura's husband works as a farmer. 

To earn a consistent living wage, Firuza works as a merchant. She learned her trade early on in her childhood. When she was 15 years old, she traded products to pay for her school expenses. She used to sell a just bit of produce, but now she has significantly expanded and stabilized her business. Since 2011, she repeatedly received loans from Arvand to grow her business, which helped her successfully expand her business and grow the profits earned from it. 

Today, she has a store where she sells her goods. She also has a wide assortment of food products, consisting of canned foods, pastries, pastas, teas, coffee, as well as household goods such as soap, laundry detergents and others. Firuza buys her products from suppliers and sells them in her neighborhood. 

Her progress does not stop there--she wants to further expand her business, since demand for her existing products is growing and demand for new products is developing in her neighborhood. Firuza has applied for a loan from Arvand to purchase additional products to better equip her store. She is very grateful for the financial support from Arvand.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to better equip her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as aggressive. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank that will benefit five members of her family. The family faces a challenge of obtaining water. The tank will enable them to access and store clean water. She does have a business to earn an income. She also keeps cows to earn extra income. She hopes that in future she will be stable and successful. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of KES 80,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 52-year-old father of five children. To be able to provide for their needs, he opened a retail store where he sells various things like home products and computer supplies. He also has in his store a small section for selling food products. Omar is seeking a loan to expand the food section as it has attracted increasing demand. He wants to offer new types of basic food products like sugar, rice, flour and canned food.

loans.use: to offer new types of basic food products like sugar, rice, flour and canned food.

loans.name: Jhon Alexander

texts.es: John Alexander es un hombre de 27 años de edad, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica al negocio de la chatarrería, oficio que conoció gracias a su suegro, quien era el dueño anterior de este negocio, pero hace 2 años falleció y el negocio pasó a ser propiedad del prestatario. Se caracteriza por ser enérgico y emprendedor, se esmera por sacar su negocio adelante para obtener los recursos con los que sustenta sus necesidades. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea comprar más chatarra ya que ésta genera buenas utilidades al venderla, y adicionalmente desea pagar algunas cuentas a sus proveedores. Su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su negocio con el fin de aumentar sus ventas, incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida  y, poder generar más oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Jhon Alexander is a 27-year-old man who is single and has no children. He currently manages a scrap metal business, a trade that he learned from his partner’s father who previously owned the business. When the owner died two years ago, the business passed on to Jhon Alexander. He is known for being energetic and enterprising.

Jhon Alexander strives to move his business forward by obtaining the resources he needs to sustain it. The loan he is requesting from Interactuar will be used to buy more scrap metal that he can sell to generate a good profit. He would also like to pay a few bills from his suppliers. His greatest wish is to grow his business so that he can increase his sales, earn more needed income to improve his quality of life, and create more job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal in bulk.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en: Salam is a 49-year-old mother of  four children. Her husband works at a university but his salary is not enough to cover their living expenses. For that reason, Salam started selling home products and a few home accessories. Now, she is seeking a loan to buy more home products and kitchenwares to sell.

loans.use: to buy more home products and kitchenwares to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 32-year-old man who recently got married. He has a car repairing shop that has been registered for two years. Now Mohammad is seeking a loan to buy some repairing equipment and new tools for the shop to enhance the services that he offers.

loans.use: to buy some repairing equipment and new tools for his shop

loans.name: Kumah

texts.en: Kumah is a 42-year-old widow who lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. Kumah did not go to school. She has seven children between 8 and 20 years old. Three of her children are in school and live at home. For the past 15 years, she been selling flour, rice, bread, sugar, etc. in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money provided by her late husband’s family. She learned this business from her friends. She likes her business because of the positive ways people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, rice, bread, sugar, etc. for her business. She hopes to have more money to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, rice, bread, sugar etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mirabbos

texts.ru: Мираббос жизнерадостный и позитивный мужчина в возрасте 55 лет. Женат имеет пятерых детей. Все его дети уже взрослые и четверо из них живут отдельно со своими семьями. Скоро Мираббос собирается женить последнего младшего сына.  Несмотря на то, что его дети взрослые и зарабатывают самостоятельно,  Мираббос  всегда им помогает чем может, благодаря отцу они многого добились в своей жизни. Сам Мирабос работает таксистом, для этого он купил собственную машину. Жена Мираббоса работает главным поваром в местной столовой. Старший сын находится на заработках в России, а младший сын работает мастером художником. Все члены семьи заняты своим маленьким делом, которое приносит доход в семью. Мираббос в ближайшем будущем собирается женить младшего сына, и поэтому он хочет построить для него дом, чтобы он мог там жить со своей семьёй. Зарабатываемых денежных средств не хватит, чтобы позволить себе построение дома. Поэтому Мираббос обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит для покупки строительных материалов на строительство дома. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mirabbos is a cheerful and positive 55-year-old man. He is married and has five children. All of his children are grown up and four of them live independently with their own families. Mirabbos is getting ready to marry off his youngest son soon. Despite the fact that his children are grown up and are earning money independently, Mirabbos always helps them as much as he can. Thanks to their father, his children have been able to achieve many things in life. 

Mirabbos works as a taxi driver, for which he had to buy his own car. His wife works as the head chef in a local cafeteria. His oldest son works abroad in Russia, and his youngest son works as a painter. All members of the family have their own businesses that bring income for the family. 

In the near future, Mirabbos intends to marry off his youngest son, and wants to build him a house so that he can live there with his family. His own earnings are not enough to afford building a house. For that reason, Mirabbos turned to Arvand and hopes to receive a loan to purchase building materials in order to build a house. He hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Wilson Omar

texts.es:
Wilson, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en casa propia y está acompañado, disfruta de un niño de dos años. El, es transportista y realiza viajes con un microbús para obtener ingresos y cubrir los gastos del hogar, el oficio lo lleva a cabo desde hace un año y lo inicio con un amigo, con el cual hicieron la inversión para comprar el microbús y lo realiza de lunes a viernes.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar repuestos al microbús, por ejemplo: ejes, boleros, cables de frenos, llantas. Esta inversión le ayudara a hacerle mejoras al medio de transporte y con ello brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes, asimismo aumentar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es adquirir una vida mejor económicamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Wilson is 26 years old. He lives in his own house and has a live-in partner, and he is blessed with a 2-year-old son. He is a transportation provider, making trips with a microbus to obtain income and cover his household expenses. He has been exercising this profession for a year, and he started it with a friend; together they made the investment to buy the microbus. He does this work from Monday through Friday. 

The loan he needs will permit him to buy spare parts for the microbus, for example axles, bearings, brake cables, and tires. This investment will help him improve his means of transportation, and thus provide better service to his customers, while increasing his income. 

His dream is to achieve an economically better life with his family.

loans.use: to buy axles, bearings, brake cables, and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to paint her house and pay for a few repairs.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is a 32-year-old married woman who has four children. With her husband's work alone, her family does not make enough to cover their living expenses, so she started a small home business selling detergents that she buys in large quantities and sells in smaller bottles. She also learned to mix scents to make perfumes to sell. Mai is now seeking a loan to increase her stock of detergents and get more bottles to refill.

loans.use: to increase her stock of detergents and get more bottles to refill.

loans.name: Madres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Madres Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número 10º del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y de esa forma poder conocer la situación de cada una ellas. Gracias a esto se pudo conocer que dos de ellas están con ingresos muy bajos.
Una integrante digna de comentar es la Sra. Maria, quien es la presidenta del grupo, ella es una persona sobresaliente en su cargo, motiva a sus compañeras a seguir y mejorar cada día. Ella por su parte se dedica a la venta de empanadas de todas clases, y cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene muy buena clientela.
Esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus empanadas, como ser carnes, verduras, condimentos y demás, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas y creciendo en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers) is in its tenth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. The members have taken a poverty elimination survey so that each of them could become familiar with their individual situations. Thanks to the results, it was discovered that two of the women are at a very low income level.

One member who is worthy of mention is Sra. Maria, the group president. She is an outstanding individual who is in charge of motivating her fellow group members to move forward and improve each day. Maria spends her time selling empanadas of all kinds and is doing very well. She has a very good customer base.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies needed to continue making empanadas such as meat, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients. This will allow her to continue her sales and grow her income.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Benilda

texts.es:
Benilda, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, por el beneficio que se adapta a sus ingresos con el proceso de la agricultura, esta vez utilizara los fondos para la compra de abono, herbicidas, semilla, para realizar el cultivo.
Con el préstamo anterior el efecto que tuvo fue muy bueno, ya que la cosecha le ayudo a mejorar los ingresos y asimismo  la venta de tortillas, es por ello que se ha animado a solicitar un nuevo préstamo, sus condiciones económicas han cambiado, debido a los ingresos en su familia.
texts.en:
Benilda has decided on a new loan because she has adapted to the benefit to her income with the agricultural process.  This time she will use the funds for the purchase of fertilizers, herbicides and seeds to carry out planting.

The effect that the previous loan had was very good as the harvest helped her to improve her income as well as the sale of tortillas. That is why she is encouraged to request a new loan.  Her economic circumstances have changed due to the income in her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and seeds.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane and her husband live in Noravan village of Armavir region. They has been running a farm for several years. 

Their current farm isn't very big. Gayane cultivates some vegetables and greens, and her husband sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Nonetheless, the couple has not been able to save enough money for their needs and to cover the upkeep of their farm. 

So, now Gayane asks for loan to purchase a cow, fertilizer, and seeds for starting the cultivation process and to grow more vegetables to sell.

The loan is vital for Gayane and her husband to enhance their farm and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cow, fertilizer, and seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en:
Hudson is a 51-year-old father of six children. While his wife is working as a teacher, he works at his small market where he sells snacks, a few types of food products, and some cleaning sprays. 

He applied for this loan to add a new variety of products, specially food products, in preparation for Ramadan.

loans.use: to add a new variety of products, specially food products, in preparation for Ramadan.

loans.name: Nyakaizi Bakyara Tweyambe Group

texts.en: Grace is a resident of Nyakaizi, a suburb in Mbarara municipality. She is 36 years old. She did not complete school due to a lack of school fees. Grace started up a small business selling food in order to earn a living. This business has grown and helped her to take care of her family. She has asked for a loan of 500,000 UGX to buy more food to sell. She is happy to be a part of this group since it has helped her to work with other people who have similar developmental ideas. The group in total are requesting for a loan of 2,800,000 UGX to help them increase their working capital .

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 31 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. It is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She is married, she did not go to school, and she has seven children between 2 and 12 years old. Only three of them are in school, and they live at home. 

For the past five years, she been selling fish. She started this business with some money from her husband, and she learned this business from her  mother. She like her business because people buy from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business and hopes to get more money so that she can build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Plinio

texts.es: Plinio, de 26 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres y sus hermanos en una casa alquilada desde hace 3 años. Como hijo mayor ayuda a la familia en todo lo que necesita. Comenta que hace poco ingresó a trabajar en una fábrica de cemento, por lo que decidió abrir un negocio en su casa, donde su madre pueda dedicarse y así ya no seguir trabajando en el campo pues ya es mayor y no desea que se enferme. Es así que ahora posee una tienda de productos comestibles surtida y muy buena. Le va muy bien en su negocio, comenta que no tiene la afluencia de otras de la zona, pero que poco a poco podrá mejorar abasteciendo su tienda con todo lo necesario para que sus clientes encuentren todo tipo de alimentos. Ahora desea capital de trabajo para poder abastecer a su tienda y así dar el primer paso para mejorarlo. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA, por ello agradece el apoyo recibido ya que esto le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Plinio, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros..
texts.en:
Plinio, 26, is a responsible man.  He has lived for three years in a rented house with his parents and siblings.  As the oldest child he helps his family with everything they need.

He says that recently he started working in a cement factory, so he decided to open a store in his house where his mother can work and no longer work in the fields.  She's older now and he doesn't want her to get sick.  This is how he happens to have a well-stocked and very good grocery store.

His business is going very well for him.  He says he doesn't have the traffic of other stores in the area, but little by little he'll be able to improve, stocking his store with everything he needs so his customers will find all types of food.

Now he wants working capital to be able to stock his store and take the first step toward improving it.  This is his first Kiva loan and he's grateful for the support he has received because it will help him improve his income.

Plinio will invest the 1000 soles [PEN] in food products such as rice, sugar, milk, and others.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah is 43 years old; she lives and works in Buchanan, which is located by the sea and is the capital city of Grand Bassa county.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Siah is married, and she completed 12th grade.  She has a two-year-old child who is in school, and lives at home.  

She has been selling soft drinks for the last four years. She spends 8 hours a day, 6 days a week with her business. Siah started this business with a little amount from her husband; she learned this business from her mother.

She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business; she hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 56-year-old widow, and all of her children are married. 

Fatmeh works in embroidery to keep on making a productive person of herself and make a living. She is seeking a loan to buy more thread and fabric to do some embroidery work on it and turn it into table and pillow covers.

loans.use: to buy more thread and fabric to do some embroidery work on it and turn it into table and pillow covers.

loans.name: Al Muthanna

texts.en: Al Muthanna, 21, is a single young man. One of 5 siblings, he is now a university student majoring in water and land management. He is seeking a loan to pay for the next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for the next semester's fees.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a university student majoring in English language. She is a 20-year-old sister for five siblings. Their only basic income is her father’s retirement salary. 

Ola is seeking an educational loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as God-fearing and self-determined. She will use this loan of 20,000 KES to buy a water tank that will benefit five family members. With this tank, they will be able to store enough clean water for domestic use. The family faces the challenge of the lack of enough water, and she faces competition in her business. She operates a retail shop to earn an income. She hopes that in future she will obtain financial freedom and improve her family's living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans of 20,000 and 80,000 KES were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank.

loans.name: Nirmeen

texts.en: Nirmeen, 23, is a single lady living with her five siblings. She goes to university to study and get her bachelor degree in accounting. Now she is seeking an educational loan to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a 42-year-old married man and the father to one daughter. Jamal has a car repairing shop, and he wants to renew its registration and license, so he applied to this loan in order to get the rest of the money that can help him do so.

loans.use: To renew his shop registration and license.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 29 years old. He is a farmer and has been a rice farmer for the past six years. He is married with two children and they are still too young to attend school. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from farming will be used to build a house.
