Samuel holds a recording book, where he keeps his records.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 42 years old. He is married with five children and they all go to school. He has been working as a rice farmer for six years. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. Jean Bosco plans to use the profits for buy a land for rice cultivation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Lukashin village of the Armavir region with her husband. They are involved in beekeeping and own a small and beautiful farm, which they take care with great pleasure and enthusiasm. The couple gets high quality honey, sells it locally and gathers income. 

Susanna is 58 years old and her husband is 66 years old, so it is very hard for them to find job and their income comes only from their agricultural business. That's why Susanna and her husband want to enlarge their farm. Susanna has requested this loan to purchase seven colonies of bees and to expand her honey selling business. Over several years of hard work Susanna and her husband were able to create a business and minimal conditions for living. The loan is very important for them to enlarge their farm and improve their life.

loans.use: to pay for seven colonies of bees

loans.name: Marie Leatitia

texts.en: Marie Leatitia aged 40. She is mother of three aged between 16 and 21, and they all go to school. She has spent six years in farming. With the loan, she wants to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Martiros

texts.en:
Martiros had to take care of and bring up his son alone, by working hard and through the many problems that can emerge in an agricultural business. Martiros owns a small farm, which includes chickens, pigs and piglets. He also cultivates greens for feeding the animals and grows apricot and cheery trees. Martiros lives together with his mother, sister and 33-year-old son. All family members help Martiros with farming activities. His mother gives important advice on how cultivate fruits and vegetables and his son sells the gathered harvest locally. 

Martiros also works at local aviculture company, but his main income comes from agriculture. Now he is asking a loan to purchase chickens and special forage for feeding them. This will increase his monthly income and will help him to cover daily costs. Additional money from the loan will be used for purchasing fuel for transporting harvest to the market.

This family is very hard working and has great plans for their farm. So this loan will be a good step for reaching their goals. They anticipate your support.

loans.use: to pay for chickens and special forage for them, and to cover fuel costs

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de Jesús con 48 años de edad es madre de familia de 3 hijos, ama de casa y agricultora desde hace muchos años la cual con mucho esfuerzo en compañía de su esposo trabajan arduamente para salir adelante. Ella pudo cursar hasta el 4 grado de la primaria y por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres ella no pudo estudiar pero fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña. En compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijos se dirigen diariamente a dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café. Su hijo mayor no está involucrado ya que él está viviendo fuera del país EE.UU y la ayuda enviando remesas para que ellos puedan cubrir los gastos escolares y otros en el hogar como la compra de víveres, medicinas con muchas restricciones, etc.  

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos como: urea, fertilizantes, abono, foliares entre otros que protegen a sus cultivos de bichos y enfermedades como la roya.

Sus sueños son los de darle una buena educación a sus hijos que ellos puedan escoger carreras de secundaria y a nivel superior que les puedan ayudar en la vida como personas, como empresarios y hasta como padres y madres de familia.
texts.en:
Mariana de Jesús, 48, is the mother of three children.  She has been a housewife and farmer for many years.  She and her husband work with a lot of effort to get ahead.

She was able to study up to the fourth grade of elementary school.  She wasn't able to continue because her parents couldn't help economically.  They were the ones who taught her how to work the land at a young age, however.  She and her husband and two children go every day to take care of their coffee crops.  Her oldest son isn't involved because he lives abroad in the United States and helps her by sending remittances so they can cover the school and household expenses such as food, medicines with a lot of limitations, etc.

She has asked COMIXMUL for a loan to buy inputs such as urea, fertilizer, soil amendments, foliar applications, and other things to protect her plants from insects and diseases like blight.

Her dreams are to give her children a good education so they can choose high school and college courses that will help them in life as individuals, as entrepreneurs, and even as fathers and mothers.

loans.use: to buy inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Thadee

texts.en:
Thadee is 46 years old. He has six children, and has been a rice farmer for the past six years. His wife also works as a farmer. With the loan, he wants to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to provide health insurance to his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is Isata. She is 36, married, and has three children, aged 16, 13, and 9. In 2000, Isata established her rice and local foodstuffs business in the city center. Isata started her business because she wanted to help her husband to take care of the home with her own financial contribution. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 1,400,000 SLL every month. 

Isata would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL to buy more bags of rice as she now has more customers. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her profits margin by Le 600,000. Isata has not yet succeeded in renting a shop for herself but is still working hard towards it. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 22 years old. He is single and has spent six years in the business of growing rice. He wants the loan to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow, which can provide milk.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor cost during rice production

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 32 years old. He is married with four children. His wife also works as a farmer. He has requested a loan for buying more fertilizers and to support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to buy a milling machine which will generate more income.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Kiringa Development 11 Group

texts.en:
Harriet is a member of Kiringa Development group and a mother aged 35 years, with four children. She stays in a village in Katojo Parish, Kambuga Sub County. When she got married, the situation at home was not okay. She decided to start up a small tea selling business which she managed to do for over four years, and after saving a good amount, she changed to selling second hand clothes.

Harriet has managed this second hand clothes business for quite some time now, and it has enabled her to pay tuition for all her children. She came to know about KIVA funds with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. She secured a loan of 600,000 Uganda Shillings to boost her business, which she expects will help her serve more customers and increase her profits.

She thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for helping her and giving her this loan to boost her business. She is excited to maintain the partnership along with her group members, as they were able to secure loans even without collateral.

loans.use: To sell second hand clothes

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухаё 35 лет. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она очень добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Мухаё имеет очень трудную судьбу. Ее муж бросил ее с 4 детьми. Мухаё должна обеспечить своих детей. Мухаё решила организовать свой бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей продуктовых товаров. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки продуктов питания, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhayo is 35 years old. She is divorced and has four children. She is very kind and goal oriented woman. Muhayo has a difficult fate. Her husband has left her with four children and she has to provide for them. Muhayo has decided to start her own business for the well being of her family. With this goal she has taken the Achieve Success course organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. Right now she can start her own business and become successful in this field. She wants to start a business buying and selling food items. She plans to use the received income to provide for her children with good education and high calorie food. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 USD to buy food items to start her new business. She is awaiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy food to start a new business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 50 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She is a widow. She went to school but stopped in the 2nd grade. For the past six years she has been selling charcoal. She started this business with a small amount from her children, and she learned this business from her friends. She likes her business because it keeps her busy. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as committed. He has taken a loan of 15,000 KES to buy a water tank that will benefit four family members.This will enable them to access water easily. The family faces the challenge of water harvesting. His source of income is a quarry where he sells construction stones. He hopes that in future he will be stable and successful. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank.

loans.name: Pascal Romain

texts.fr: pascal est une camerounais de 29 ans, marié et père de trois enfants. il gère la vente des beignets à l'aide d'un pouce dans un quartier de la ville depuis 5 ans. Dynamique, son commerce a généré une clientèle de plus en plus abondante, d'où ces difficultés de tous les satisfaire. il voudrait ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières afin de satisfaire toute sa clientèle. les bénéfices ainsi générés vont lui permettre d’accroître son capital d'une part et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition, logement, santé)
texts.en:
Pascal, age 29, is Cameroonian. He's married and the father of three children. For five years, he's been selling doughnuts with a pushcart in one of the city's quarter.

He is energetic and his business has attracted an ever-increasing clientele, and as a result, he has trouble meeting customer demand. He would like to use this loan to bolster his stock of food ingredients in order to satisfy every customer.

The profits generated will enable him to increase his working capital and also provide for his family (education, food, housing, healthcare).

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for his doughnut business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has one child, age 13 years. She has three additional dependents that live with her, and she assists them with their schooling.   

In 1996, Fatmata established her textiles business. She began her business just after her mother died and she took over the business. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are women. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy one bail of cotton. She hopes that this loan will increase her monthly profit by SLL 1,000,000. 

Fatmata has not succeeded in renting a shop but one of her colleagues has promised her a suitable place for the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy one bail of cotton.

loans.name: Benetha

texts.en: Benetha is 33 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She is married. She completed grade 2 before establishing her business seven years ago. She started this business with a small amount from her husband, and she learned this business from her friends. She likes how people respond to her business, and mostly she enjoys the interaction with her customers. She works in her business for 8 hours a day, six days a week.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, vita, onions etc for her business. She hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, vita, onions etc for her business

loans.name: Martee

texts.en: Martee is 28 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She is married and has four children between two months and 10 years old, three of whom attend school. She stopped her education in 5th grade. For the past twenty years she been selling red oil in the local market in order to help her children. She started this business by selling for her mother, and she learned this business from her. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business, and she hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business

loans.name: Sofoci 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sofoci 2 fait partie de la coopérative CPSL et est situé à Meagui, une petite ville au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région du Bas Sassandra, proche de Soubré. Le groupe est composé de 8 personnes. 
Moussa a 28 ans et il est un membre du groupe Sofoci 2. Cela fait 4 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative CPSL et il a 3 hectares de cacao en cours de double certification Rain Forest Alliance/UTZ, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais et des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il veut ouvrir une boutique de proximité sans son village.
texts.en:
Sofoci 2 Group is part of the cooperative CPSL. It is located in Meagui, a small town in southwestern Côte d'Ivoire, in Bas-Sassandra Region and close to Soubré.

The group has eight members. Moussa, age 28, is one of them. He's been a member of CPSL for four years, and has three hectares of cocoa in the process of being certified by both Rain Forest Alliance and UTZ, which means he respects the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture.

Thanks to this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his plantation. These products will enable him to increase his production and his income.

With the additional money, he would like to open a convenience store in his village.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Olzii-Orshih

texts.en:
Mr. Olzii-Orshih, 57 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people for five consecutive years and has accumulated vast amount of experience in picking up customers, driving them to their destination quickly and shortening roads. His wife has a sewing workshop where she receives orders and makes dresses. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase additional sewing machines in order to replace old ones as they have deteriorated and work less efficiently. As his taxi earnings are decreasing so the entire family becomes more dependent on the sewing workshop. 

The borrower and his wife are both hardworking people who value hard work and persistence.

loans.use: to purchase additional sewing machines.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 48 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Alberto con quien tiene 7 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 20 años. Gracias a su trabajo constante pudo comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas en donde siembra alverja, maíz y demás hortalizas. Comenta que le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que recibe muy buenos ingresos económicos. Asegura que dentro de algunos meses podrá comenzar la siembra de alverja y está segura de tener buenos resultados pues cuida sus cultivos con mucho esmero. Ahora desea ahorrar más dinero para comprar su propia camioneta y así trasladar sus sembríos sin necesidad de pagar a otras personas. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y agradece el apoyo recibido ya que ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Lucy, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus próximos sembríos.
texts.en:
Lucy is a simple woman of 48. She lives with her husband Alberto with whom she has seven children, but she only lives with four of them now, and she cares for them in the house she bought 20 years ago. Thanks to her constant hard work, she was able to buy her own farm fields, where she plants peas, corn, and other vegetables. She says that she is very fond of her work because it gives her a very good income. She also says that she will be able to start planting the peas in a few months and she is sure to have good results because she puts a lot of care into her crops. 

Now she wants to save up money to buy her own small truck in order to transport her crops without having to pay anyone else for it. This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the support she has received, because it will help her increase her income. Furthermore, she is committed to being on time with her payments. Lucy will invest 1000 Nuevos Soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her next crop.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Salvador Manuel

texts.es:
Salvador, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permtira comprar  productos variados como shampoo, cremas, lociones, utensilios, para el hogar y otros, con los cuales espera mejorar sus pedidos, agregando más variedad al negocio, ya que así satisface las demandas de los clientes, aprovechando para mejorar sus ganancias. 
Las condiciones economicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado con el credito anterior.
texts.en:
Salvador is asking for a new loan to be used in investing in his business. This loan will allow him to purchase various products like shampoo, creams, lotions, and tools for home and more. He hopes that with these items he will have higher demand and will help him to continue growing his business because he will be able to meet customer demand and will be able to improve his earnings. 
His family's economic conditions and circumstances that improved with the previous loan.

loans.use: purchase shampoo, lotion, tools.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en:
Korpo is 42 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Korpo is married. She did not go to school and has four children aged between 19 and eight years old. For the past fifteen years, she has been selling red (palm) oil in the local market. She started this business with a little amount of money from her husband, and she learned this business from her friends. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. She hopes to get more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Ruth is married, she completed 7th grade and has two-year-old child who is in school, and lives at home. For the past four years she has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She started this business with a little amount of money from her husband who works with Firestone. She learned this business from her mother. She like her business because of the ways people respond to it. She spend ten hours a day with her business six day a week. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She hopes to own a house one day.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Bayanmunkh

texts.en: Bayanmunkh, 39 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their old house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people using his own automobile since 2011. His wife gets a welfare pension monthly. His children both go to high school. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some renovation such as replacing old windows and insulating walls. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as vacuum insulated windows, planks, shingles, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he can repair and insulate his house and provide comfortable and warm accommodations for his family. The renovated house will enable the family to reduce its coal consumption, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere, which will have a positive impact on efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is a 45-year-old single mother with two children who lives in Ger in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her older son is 24 and works at various types of jobs to help his mother, and her younger son Buyandelger studies at a local school. Bolormaa has been providing a shoe repair service business for the last 12 years and she rents a small place which is located in the ger district area where most of the residents are low-income level and cannot afford to purchase expensive new shoes. She has built close relationships with her clients over the years. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase secondhand shoes in bulk to sell to local customers to increase her income. She is an optimistic, strong and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand shoes in bulk to sell to local customers to increase her income

loans.name: Alberto Felix

texts.es:
Alberto es un joven de 27 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo  se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, entre otros.  Alberto debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado  estudiar la carrera de ingeniería civil.

Día a día Alberto trabaja en su pequeño negocio de cerrajería, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 3 clientes diariamente ya que los trabajos son muy laboriosos; el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y responsable y cumplido con ellos.

Alberto esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una maquina soldadora para su negocio ya que actualmente tiene que alquilarla, de esta manera podrá tener mayores ingresos y atender a sus clientes con mayor prontitud, lo que l permitira seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Ser un empresario de éxito.
texts.en:
Alberto, 27, lives in the city of Ica which is known for its warm, welcoming climate and agriculture, especially crops such as grapes, asparagus, etc.  Because of the scarce economic resources he had, Alberto was only able to get a fifth grade education; but he would have liked to study civil engineering.

Every day Alberto works in his small metal carpentry shop where he spends about nine hours a day attending to up to three customers, since the jobs are burdensom.  He feels he is able to prosper because he is kind to customers and responsible in complying with their wishes.

Alberto is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to you he has been able to buy a welding machine for his business.  Before he had to rent the machine so this will help increase his income by serving customers quicker.  He will also be able to continue striving toward his greatest goal: "To become a successful business owner".

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica de 62 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Naval con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con una de ellas en su casa propia. 
A pesar de su avanzada edad sigue trabajando con mucho esfuerzo, pues todos los días trabaja sin descanso para cuidar sus sembríos de alverja, espinaca, cebolla y demás hortalizas. Comenta que mientras cuida de sus sembríos, pastea a sus animales entre ovejas y cerdos. Pues la crianza de sus animales le ayuda a mejorar sus economía, “cuando necesito dinero vendo uno de mis animales”, afirma. Es así que desea seguir trabajando con mayor esmero pues desea sacar adelante a su pequeña hija hasta convertirla en una profesional. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y agradece el apoyo recibido ya que esto le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas,
Angélica invertirá los S/.300 soles en la compra de sacos de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Angélica, 62, is a hard-working woman who lives with her husband, Naval, and one of their five children in their own house.

Despite her age she continues working with much effort and goes out every day to care for her crops: peas, spinach, onions and other vegetables.  She says that while she cares for the crops she also feeds her sheep and pigs.  Raising animals has helped improve her economy, "When I need money I sell one of my animals.", she says.  This is why she wants to continue working with care so she can provide for her daughter and see her become a professional.  

This is Angélica's first KIVA loan and thanks to your support she will be able to increase her income.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and plans to use the loan to buy sacks of organic fertilizder for her crops.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Yonatan

texts.es:
Yonatan es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de uva, algodón, esparrago, entre otros.  Desde  joven yonatan aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y debido a ello tuvo la necesitad de trabajar, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria.

Luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Yonatan logro iniciar su negocio de venta de pollos al reparto, el visita a muchos clientes en la ciudad y entrega sus productos especialmente en bodegas, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y el cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Yonatan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar pollos al por mayor en las granjas y con ello poder atender mucho mejor a sus clientes, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y sobre todo poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Yonatan, 21, lives in the city of Ica which is known for its warm, welcoming climate and agriculture, especially crops such as grapes, cotton, asparagus, etc.  From a very young age Yonatan learned to earn an income by the sweat of his brow, since his parents had scarce economic resources so he had to work.  This is why he was only able to get a fifth grade education; but he would have liked to get a university degree.

After much effort and saving his money, Yonatan was able to start a chicken delivery business.  He visits many customers throughout the city and delivers his products especially to stores.  He works around nine hours a day and believes he is prospering because he is kind to customers and is determined to get ahead.

Yonatan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to you he is able to buy chickens wholesale on farms and is able to attend to his customers much better.  He will be able to improve his income and, especially, be able to realize his dream: "Owning a home".

loans.use: To buy chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en:
Korpo is 45 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Korpo is married, and has seven children between 28 and 15 years old. Only one is in school, and lives at home. For the past ten years, she has been selling fish in the local market in order to help her children. She started this business by selling for her mother, and she learned this business from friends. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. In the future, she hopes hope to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Erika Guadalupe Yazmin

texts.es:
Erika tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera. Es una mujer joven, aplicada al trabajo  y le gusta mucho cuidar el ganado, cuando llego hace 6 años al lugar en donde vive, comenzó junto con su padre a comprar ganado lechero por aparte. Hoy en día tiene 5 vacas lecheras, este rubro lo aprendió junto con su padre que ya sabía un poco sobre el manejo, y además ha recibido cursos sobre ganadería.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 quintales de harina de soya y después invertirá poco a poco lo demás del dinero para ir comprando mas alimento para el ganado.

Con el crédito se estará apoyando al cliente para que pueda comprar los insumos y así pueda darles una mejor alimentación al ganado para  tener una mayor producción de leche.
 
ella, mejorará su nivel de ingresos ya que el ganado tendrá una mejor dieta alimenticia y la producción de leche será mayor. También podrá hacer productos derivados de la leche para consumo de su familia mejorando su alimentación.

     Entre sus planes, esta ir adquiriendo más experiencia en cuanto al manejo del ganado y tener muchos más animales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Erika, 28, is a single, hard-working young lady who enjoys caring for her cattle.  Six years ago, when she arrived where she lives, she and her father began buying dairy cattle.  Now they have five cows and she has learned from her father how to manage the business, while also taking courses in livestock farming.

The loan she is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy 400 lbs. of soy flour.  She will use the rest of the money to buy animal feed for her cattle.  Through the support of the loan the borrower will be able to buy the supplies she needs to give her livestock better feed and also increase her milk production.

Erika's income will improve with the increase in milk production because of a better diet for her cattle.  She will also be able to make dairy products for family consumption, which will improve their diet.

Her plans for the future include acquiring more experience in managing livestock and having more animals to raise.

loans.use: To buy 400 lbs. of soy flour and animal feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan  es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de pisco, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se puede encontrar lugares turísticos hermosos, muy visitados por los turistas. Juan es un joven que ha atravesado por momentos difíciles, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a  sus padres, por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Administración de empresas.

Con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro  iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas , al que le dedica alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; él cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo por sus ganas de progresar.

Juan esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abarrotes para su negocio como arroz, fideos por paquetes, azúcar, atún, entre otros; lo cual permitirá que pueda atender a sus clientes de mejor manera y mejorar sus ingresos, así el seguirá luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener un local propio y también tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Juan, 20, is a young man who lives in the city of Pisco which is known for its warm, welcoming climate.  It is also a place with many beautiful tourist attractions and many visitors.  Juan has had some difficult times in life because his parents had scarce economic resources so he had to work to support them.  He was only able to get a fifth grade education, but would have liked to get a degree in business administration.

With much effort and by saving his money, Juan was able to start selling groceries and beverages.  He works around nine hours and attends to up to 20 customers a day.  He believes his is prospering because he is very kind to customers and determined to get ahead.

Juan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your help he is able to buy groceries for his business such as rice, noodles, sugar, tuna, etc.  This will allow him to give his customers better service and improve his income.  He will able to continue in his daily struggle toward realizing his dream: "To have his own grocery store and his own house".

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, noodles, sugar, tuna, etc.

loans.name: Edralin

texts.en:
Edralin, 44 years old, is married and blessed with five children. He own and manages a transportation business, particularly motorcycle transport. He is glad that he can earn a net income of PHP 500 a day.  

He is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase spare parts and tires for his tricycle. He is hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can provide better services to his passengers.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and tires for his tricycle.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is a mother of seven. She has the patience and strong determination to improve her family's standard of living. To support her family, she is engaged in a fish-selling business.  

Her desire to improve her business made her take a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy more fish. She hopes that by having additional capital, her business will become a more viable source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is engaged in an agricultural business. He has two hectares of land where he grows corn and he also maintains a hog-raising business.  He is 40 years old and still single. Gabriel is the fifth child of nine siblings.

Gabriel would like to provide his hogs with proper nutrition and care so he can make them healthier upon reaching their maturity period. To make his goal possible, he is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 which will enable him to buy necessary supply of feeds and vitamins.  

He knows that with financial assistance from the lenders, he can make his business grow and support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, is married with four children. She has owned and operated a general store selling groceries in town for five years to make a living. 

In 2008, she joined GDMPC and it helps her to improve her ability to engage in business and also to gain access to micro-finance services. 

She took a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, bottled products, sugar and milk. She plans to expand her store and to sell general merchandise in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, bottled products, sugar and milk.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nyamgur

texts.en:
Nyamgur is 32-years-old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a rental place in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Monhjargal, stays home taking care of their family. His son, Monhsaihan, is 9 years old and studies at primary school and his daughter, Tuguldur, is 3 and stays home with her mother. 

Nyamgur has been working at a local company for several years and is now starting his own business of hand-crafted Mongolian Traditional Musical instruments at home. He used to craft a few instruments during his free-time to sell to tourists or locals. He is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase tools and equipment to make his musical instrument craft business official. He is an optimistic and hardworking young man.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment to make his musical instrument craft business official.

loans.name: Otgontugs

texts.en:
Otgontugs is 47-years-old and lives with his wife and a son in small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Tsogzolmaa, is 48-years-old. She partially lost the ability to work and stays home. His son Bayandalai is 15 and studies at a local school. 

Otgontugs has been providing a transportation services business in town since 1998 with his old Russian truck and recently its motor has broken and he is no longer be able to continue his business. He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to fix his truck's motor and restart his business of transportation services. He is a hardworking, kind and responsible man.

loans.use: to fix his truck's motor and restart his business of transportation services.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is earning an income through her direct selling business of AVON and NATASHA products. This is her way of helping her husband in providing for the needs of their family, especially their seven children.  

She plans to purchase more products to offer but she lacks capital. For this reason, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase lotion, face powder, soap, perfumes and other personal products. Having more products to offer, she knows that she will increase her sales and improve their way of living.

loans.use: to purchase different personal products.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 31-years-old and blessed with four children. She is working hard so she can provide for their needs. She is engaged in the fish selling business in their village.  

Her wish to make her business profitable will be possible if she can have additional capital from the lenders. She is now borrowing a loan of Php 5,000.00 to purchase more fish to sell. Jocelyn is very hopeful that her business will become successful so they will have a better way of living.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 26 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer and together they cultivate their farm land by planting vegetables and root crops. 

They plan to have more kinds of vegetables to grow and sell and this has encouraged them to take a loan of PHP 10,000. This will be used to buy fertilizers and insecticides to sustain their crop production. Through this loan, she believes that they will improve their farming business and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida, who is 32 years old, manages a fish-vending business selling fresh and dried fish. She wishes to continue contributing to her family's financial stability by improving her business. This is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000, which she will utilize to purchase more fresh and dried fish to sell.  

Loida is hoping for her business to grow and become profitable so she can provide her child a good future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, who is 23 years old, is a single parent blessed with one child. She owns and manages a vegetable-vending business in their village, and it is located near a national highway. She has managed this business for nearly four years and is grateful for having a daily net income of PHP 700.  Aside from vegetables, she also sells fish for additional income. She wishes for her business to flourish. To make this possible, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase tomatoes, squash, string beans and eggplants to sell.  

Rosemarie is hoping that her business will be more productive in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, squash, string beans and eggplants to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a widow living in Tukuran. She is 58 years old and has two children. Erlinda owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale to earn a living. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business.
Erlinda requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She planned to develop cultivated land to have an abundant harvest and to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en: Pathani is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She runs a small general store in the corner of her house for the people of her community. She offers a variety of food items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR, which she will use to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. This is her third loan, and she has a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Гулнора приветливая, порядочная и честная женщина, занимающаяся торговым бизнесом. Ей 23 года. Она замужем и у нее двое маленьких детей - сыну 5 лет и дочери 2 годика. Её муж в данное время на заработках в загранице. Она с дочерью,сыном и свекровью проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе Хатлонской области. Гулнора начала заниматься торговым бизнесом еще с юного возраста. Она в течение 9 лет продает на рынке района ткани и материалы для шитья национального платья. За эти годы торговли Гульнора узнала все нюансы своего бизнеса и хорошо знает как обращаться с покупателями, чтобы ее товар был всегда в спросе. Гулнора любит свою деятельность, потому что она продвигает быт за счет дохода, приносящий ей ее упорный труд. Сейчас Гулнора хотела бы продвинуть бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение. Она запрашивает кредит для закупа разнообразного ассортимента тканей, чтобы увеличить ее товарооборот. 
Ее планы на будущее - это открытие магазина для продажи одежды.
texts.en: Gulnora is a friendly, decent and honest woman who has a sales business. She is 23 years old, married and has two small children. Her son is five years old and her daughter is two years old. Her husband at this time is working abroad. She lives with her daughter, son and mother-in-law live in the town of Qurgan-Tube in the Hatlonskiy region. Gulnora began her sales business since her young age. During the nine years she has been selling fabrics and materials for sewing of traditional dresses on the region's market. During these years of selling Gulnora has discovered all tricks of her business and knows well how to communicate with her customers so that her merchandise is always in demands. Gulnora loves her business because she grows her household by using the profit which she makes by her hard work. Right now Gulnora wants to grow her business and improve her financial situation. She is asking for a loan to buy different assortment of fabrics to increase her sales. Her plans for the future are opening a store to sell clothing.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of fabrics and growing of business.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She has been actively involved in the business of animal sales for the last six years. She buys animals, including baby goats and baby cows, at low prices, and raises the animals. Then, her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Most recently, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase one more goat. This is her fifth loan, and she has shown good repayment behavior. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more goat.

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en: Aneela is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She has been successfully running her own beauty parlor for three years. She offers many services to her customers such as hair styling, makeup, and facials. By doing her best to provide services, she has become very famous on her street. To meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a larger variety of products for the parlor, but, due to low capital, she is unable to meet with the increasing demands of her customers. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. This is her third loan, and she has a good repayment history. She wishes to use a part of her revenues to provide a good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: At the age of 31, Abida is married and a hardworking lady. She has been doing a business of juice sales with the support of her husband for six years. Her husband buys stocks of juices in various flavors from a wholesale market, and then they supply the juices in the local market at a higher price. Gradually, they have become famous for providing good quality juices and have retained a good customer base. They manage their household expenses through their business and want to grow their business to fulfill the increasing demands of the family members. For this reason, Abida requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more stocks of juices in different flavors. This is her fifth loan, and she has a good repayment history. She expects to boost her earning and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of juices in different flavors.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 46-year-old hard-working lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She is very expert in stitching clothes according to the fashion and also knows the techniques of stitching caps in different designs. 

She has received some orders for caps for school uniforms in different sizes. But due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to complete the orders on time. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy a new stitching machine with more spools of thread in different colors to inflate her sales. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She hopes to get an increase in her net income that enables her to provide better living standards to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine with more spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store on the corner of her house. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is motivated to provide for her family. Over time she has become popular in her community for providing good quality products and she makes enough to meet the expenses of her household. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She is a vigorous lady and for the past year she has been actively involved in selling bed covers. She buys a variety of bed covers of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community at reasonable prices. She knows that her husband cannot bear the household expenses alone. 

She applied for a 30,000 PKR loan from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of bed covers in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with this new loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of bed covers in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 27-year-old married lady; mother of one child. She has been stitching bed covers for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She very well knows the techniques of stitching bed covers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a new stitching machine and stock of threads in different colors to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine and stock of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 30-year-old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns an electronics repair shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He repairs electric fans. 

Presently he don't have repairing stock for his shop so he wants to purchase electronis repair tools and copper wire so that he can continue his work. However due to the lack of cash, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Bushra has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. 

With the profits her husband wants to grow his business in the future. She wish to provide all facilities to her children. Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase electronis repair tools and copper wire.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.es:
Jean es un joven de 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo tiene paisajes hermosos y sobre todo porque sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y amables. Con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de Arquitectura, sobre todo porque sus padres son personas de pocos recursos económicos pero hicieron un gran esfuerzo para poder apoyarlo en sus estudios.

Por ello luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro inicio su negocio de venta de ropa con lo cual se ayuda con algunos gastos; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene mucha ganas e progresar.

Jean está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar más ropa para vender como polos, pantalones, entre otros; de esta manera podra mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y poder tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jean is a 21 year old young man who lives in the city of Pucallpa. It is described as having a warm and pleasing climate as well as beautiful scenery and more than anything happy and kind residents. With much effort, he has been able to study architecture, more than anything because his parents are people of low income, but they made a great effort to be able to support him in his studies. 

Because of that, after a lot of hard work and savings, he started his business selling clothes, which helps with some expenses. He believes he is getting ahead because he is very responsible and above all really wants to get ahead.

Jean is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given, he will be able to buy more clothes to sell. such as shirts, pants and more. This way, he can improve his income to keep fighting to be able to make his biggest dream come true: finishing his major and owning his own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants and shorts and more.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo por el buen fondo que la Institución le brinda y por favorable la tasa de interés; este le permitirá comprar verduras tales como: zanahorias, plátanos, pipián, asimismo maíz y entre otros. 
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar las ganancias y buen crecimiento en el negocio; las condiciones económicas se han optimizado, ya que le permitió mejorar la casa por los ingresos que obtuvo, asimismo las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
María needs to take out another loan, because she needs more working capital because of the funds the institution offers her and the favorable interest rate. This will allow her ot buy vegetables such as: carrots, plantains, peppers and more. 
 
The effect of the previous loan helped her to improve her profits and have a good growth in her business. Economic conditions have improved, and this has allowed her to improve her house with the income she has obtained, as well as her family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy carrots, plantains, chiles, corn, and more.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida, age 37, is running a business making and selling ‘Dahi Bhallay’. This is a dish consisting of balls made from ground lentils, deep fried and served in a yogurt sauce. She has been doing it for a period of about three years and has worked hard to gain popularity and recognition within her town. 

With the increase in the price of vegetables and lentils, she is barely able to produce enough to make a good sale so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. In this way she will purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices which ultimately help in increasing her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenue on expansion of her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her six children.

loans.use: to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Zanib

texts.en:
Zanib, age 37, has been doing a business making shoes for the past four years. She is an energetic person and eager to support her family. She is running her business with the support of her husband and makes enough to provide the basic necessities for her four children including food, health and education. 

It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; currently she applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy additional material to make shoes including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market. She wishes to spend part of the revenues she makes on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy additional material to make shoes including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been running a business buying and selling animals for a period of about four years. She buys animals (goats and sheep) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She earns a good profit from this business. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase two more sheep. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with Kashf Foundation.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase two more sheep.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. For 15 years, she has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread-earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has four buffaloes and this has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 40-year-old widow who has been in the business of selling milk for many years. She has two milk buffaloes; she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She has two children; both are school going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. This is her second year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with its support. 

Now she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to increase her capacity to produce milk, which ultimately will help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 46 años de edad, pero tiene la alegría y las ganas de salir adelnate de un joven de 20. Ernesto vive en la ciudad de Imperial , ciudad de clima variado y en donde ´podemos encontrar playas hermosas y sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de manzana, maíz, entre otros. Debido a circunstancias del destino Ernesto saca adelante solo a su hijo de 19 años de edad, el cual se encuentra estudiando y a quien quiere muchísimo porque es el regalo mas grande que Dios le haya podido dar y e spor ello que cada dia se esfuerza para convertirlo en un hombre de bien.

Cada dia Ernesto sale a trabajar como maestro albañil,  Ernesto puede llegar a trabajar hasta 10 horas al dia, ya que depende del tamaño de la construcción; el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo realiza buenos trabajos.

Ernesto esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar tablas, andamios, ya que actualmente le hacen mucha falta para su trabajo ya que se ha hecho muy conocido y le está yendo bien en su trabajo, de esta manera podra mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Ver hecho un profesional a su hijo y ver reflejado todo su esfuerzo en el bienestar de su hijo”.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 46 years old, but he has all the energy and desire to be successful of a 20 year old. Ernesto lives in the city Imperial, a place where the climate varies and where you can find beautiful beaches as well as a developed agricultural system, especially apples and corn, among other things. Due to circumstances he attributes to fate, Ernesto is raising his son by himself, his son is currently 19 years old and is studying. Ernesto loves his son very much because he is the most wonderful gift God has blessed him with and this is the reason why he works everyday to be a better person.  

 Every day Ernesto goes out to work as construction worker and he works up to 10 hours a day, depending on the size of the construction project. He believes that he is finding success because he is responsible and always finishes his work. 

Ernesto is very thankful to the lenders at Kiva because it is thanks to their help that he will be able to purchase boards and scaffolding since he is currently in need of these items in order to do his work. He has become well  known and everything is going well in his job and he thinks he will be able to improve his earnings and to continue fighting ever day to make his biggest dream come true: to see his son have a profession and to see all his hard work reflected in the well being of his son.

loans.use: purchase wood and scaffolding.

loans.name: Ruth Noemy

texts.es:
Ruth, tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera y disfruta de dos hijos los cuales tiene edades de 3 y 6 años, vive con sus padres. Ella, se dedica a la crianza de pollos para posteriormente venderlos para obtener los ingresos necesarios y así cuidar a sus hijos, el oficio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, lo desempeña desde hace un año y lo realiza de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar pollos y concentrado para los mismos; este le permitirá aumentar la capacidad de inversión para optimizar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es mejorar su situación económica y bridarles la educación a sus hijos para que tengan un futuro favorable.
texts.en:
Ruth, 22, is a single mother and has two children ages 3 and 6. She lives with her parents. She raises chickens to later sell them to obtain the necessary income and thus to take care of her children. She learned this trade by her own initiative. She has been doing this work for a year and does it Monday to Sunday.

The loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy chickens and chicken feed. This will allow her to increase the capacity of investment to optimize her income.

Her dream is to improve her economic situation and to provide her children with education so that they have a favorable future.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyaruke  est membre du groupe d’affaire  « Rafiki», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 35 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint fut brutalement décédé suite à une maladie cardiaque. La cliente est vendeuse d’habillement et des souliers. Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la rue et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, Il y a environ 7 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  6 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The client Nyaruke is a member of the business group "Rafiki". She is a young experienced entrepreneur, 35 years old, a widow and mother to 2 children who both study. Her spouse brutally deceased following a cardiac illness. The client is a seller of clothing and shoes. She sets up her merchandise along the street and sometimes at her home. She started her business with a loan from the MFI Hekima, about 7 years ago. She will use this new loan to buy 6 pieces of pagnes [colorful African fabric]. Thus, she hopes to grow her capital, school her children and buy a plot of land for her children. Finally, she hardily thanks Hekima for its microloan support to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 6 pieces of pagnes [colorful African fabric].

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwanvua  est trésorière du groupe d’affaire  « Nazareth », entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 46 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants. Son conjoint fut décédé suite à une maladie. La cliente fait la pâtisserie, elle est vendeuse des beignets. Elle installe ses produits au petit marché qui se crée au tour de la  frontalière entre Rwanda et République Démocratique du Congo. Elle commença ses affaires avec le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 3 ans, elle fait ce petit commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 sacs de farine froment, 4 boites de levures, 10 kg de sucres, 10 litres d’huile, etc.  Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, acheter une parcelle et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The client Mwanvua is treasurer of the business group "Nazareth." She is an experienced entrepreneur, 46 years old, a widow and mother to 2 children. Her spouse died following an illness. The client bakes, she is a seller of doughnuts. She sets up her products at the little market that formed around the border between Rwanda the Democratic Republic of the Congo. She started her business with a loan from the MFI Hekima. She has been in this business for 3 years. This new loan will be used to buy 2 bags of wheat flour, 4 boxes of yeasts, 10 kg of sugars, 10 liters of oil, etc. Thus, she hopes to grow her capital, buy a plot of land and feed her children. Finally, she hardily thanks Hekima for its microloan support of small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of wheat flour, 4 boxes of yeasts, 10 kg of sugars, 10 liters of oil, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en: Reyhan, 57, is a married woman. She is a kind and industrious person. She has two children, one married daughter and a 21-year-old son. She sells food in a food stall. She sells a variety of foodstuffs, including dumplings, flat breads, and sweets. With the support of her husband, during the past 10 years she has gained much business experience in her field. With the profits earned from the business, she funded the wedding parties of her daughter and provided her with a dowry. She is an intelligent and brainy woman who says, "I will do all the best for my family." She is requesting a loan to purchase food ingredients to resell at her stall, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, sugar, and beans. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients to resell at her stall.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz, 30, is a married woman. For about 5 years, has been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater more consistently to her customers. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her children's bright future.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: Gisela de 27 años, está casada y tiene una hija de 5 años con quien vive en la casa de sus padres.La agricultura es su principal actividad económica, por eso tiene que atender a sus cultivos de arvejas, habas, maíz, y otros, con el apoyo de su esposo.“El trabajo del campo es cansado pero veo que vale la pena tanto esfuerzo”, menciona. En sus 5 años como agricultora aprendió de las peripecias que el clima y la falta de lluvias pueden provocarle, por eso ahora sale muy temprano de su hogar para llevar agua hacia sus cultivos mediante canales de agua que ella misma abre en el campo. Ahora piensa en sembrar arvejas y habas, porque se acerca la temporada de cosecha, donde los precios serán buenos. Tiene planeado alquilar un terreno más para sembrar en mayor cantidad. Este es su segundo préstamo con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero recibido ya que asi podrá seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Gisela invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Gisela, 27, is married and has a five-year-old daughter with whom she lives with in her parent's house. Agriculture is her main economic activity and that is why she must take care of her crops; peas, beans, maize, and others, with the support of her husband. “Field work is tiring but I see that it's worth all the effort." she says. 

In her 5 years as an agriculturist, she has learned about what the unexpected weather and lack of rain can cause. For that reason she now leaves home very early to water her crops by means of water channels that she herself opens in the field. Now she is thinking about planting peas and beans because the season of harvest is approaching, where the prices will be good. She is planning to rent more land to plant a greater amount. 

This it is her second loan with KIVA and she is thankful for the financial support she has received since she will be able to continue on. In addition she is committed to paying her monthly payments on time. Gisela will invest 1000 Peruvian Soles to purchase organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Llapanchispac Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; Este banco se ubicado en  la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Graciela, la socia tiene 31 años es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de vidrieria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos y tamaños de vidrios para las distintas personas que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vidrios para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de verduras, restaurante, crianza de animales menores, vidriería, elaboración de proyectos, docentes, maestro constructor.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the communal bank Llapanchispac, located in the Cusco Province in the Cusco Department. The featured member is Graciela, 31, who lives together with her partner and has a child aged one. Graciela alternates her daily activities with her glass selling business. She has been running this business for some time now, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She sells different kinds of glass of different sizes upon clients' requests. She is a responsible and determinate person, this being the way she supports her family. Graciela is applying for this loan in order to buy glass for her business. 

The other members' businesses include selling vegetables, restaurant, small animal husbandry, glass selling, project development, teaching, and construction work. The member shown in the inset photo asked for permission to be late to the meeting because of work commitments. The person who appears with a covered face is not a member of this communal bank. 

Graciela is grateful to those who contribute to her dream through the loan program, and she pledges to make her repayments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy glass for her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is married with four children. She is 55 years old, and resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Rosalinda owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for many years. Each month, she earns 9,800 PHP. In order to establish another rice farming plot, she borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit. In the future, Rosalinda wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to establish another rice farming plot.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam, 35, is a married woman and mother of two children. The man in the photo is Maryam’s husband, who is a driver by profession, providing transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for the past four years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional.
