This is his third loan with Kiva and he is thankful for the support received to move forward.  He promises to pay his quotas in a punctual manner.  Feliciano will invest 4000 soles in buying organic fertilizer for his plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Maty's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée à la même date de création du Banc Villageois et regroupe des femmes du même quartier unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Maty est la responsable ,elle est âgée de 53 ans veuve et mère de de  4 garçons de 30  27 ans et 20 ans et 18 ans et une fille de 23 ans.
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de chaussures de perles et de l’encens.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 450000 elle va acheter des chaussures d'une valeur de 100000 des pagnes à 200000 et 100000 d’encens et 500000 francs pour fonds de roulement.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine .
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins en nourriture de ses enfants .
texts.en:
This group was created on the same date as that of the 'banc villageois'. It is composed of women from the dame district united by good social and professional ties. Ms. Maty is the group's official. She is 53 years old and the mother of four boys, 30, 27, 20, and 18 years old and a girl, 23 years old. Ms. Maty is active in commerce selling shoes,  beads, and incense.

With her new loan of 450,000 francs, she is going to purchase some shoes valued at 100,000 francs, some 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) at 200,000 francs, and 100,000 francs of incense, [thus leaving 50,000 francs] in working capital. She has good experience in this domain. The profits earned enable her to meet the food needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, incense, and 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of six children. 

Caridad  is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Jenia

texts.en:
Jenia is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children. Jenia has been in farming for more than five years now. This is the source of their income. 

Jenia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man aged 37 with six children who all go to school. He is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area though at times he takes them to Kampala. He says he works seven days a week and transports cows to the city three times a month. 

He also has a banana plantation that brings him a considerable income at the end of a month and he sells milk to the nearby dairy. 

He started his cattle trade business in the year 2005 though he has been in cattle rearing all his life, and he says he has been able to pay school fees and meet his daily needs through this business. He says the need to take care of his family instigated him to start this business and he has reaped big rewards from this business. 

He says that his main clients are fellow cattle traders and butchers around his area though some who would like to purchase cows to keep also seek his services. His main challenge though is cattle diseases that lead to quarantine and is affecting his income.

He describes himself as a hard-working man and he is grateful that Kiva is interested in partnering with him.

loans.use: To buy cattle to trade.

loans.name: Ceyhun

texts.en:
Ceyhun is a 30-year-old young client who has been selling food products for past seven years without any difficulties. Ceyhun lives with his parents and he is going to marry. He works the whole day, from Monday to Sunday, because he is the only person in his family who is working, and from his business, he makes a profit of 170 AZN a month.

He is a kind and hard-working man. But he has too many problems, such as expanding his business to buy more products, repairing his home and other things. 

His first goal is to buy products. For this, he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN. With this loan, he hopes to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more products.

loans.name: Racky's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 16 mai  2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte femmes qui habitent toutes le même village, solidarité et entre aide caractérisent les relations entre membre du groupe. Elles commencent à mieux comprendre le programme et sont très actives dans le petit commerce au niveau du marché hebdomadaire du village.

Madame Racky (debout en première position de la gauche vers la droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette. Mariée et mère de deux enfants un garçon et une fille, elle est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est vendeuse de produits cosmétiques et accessoires vestimentaires (bracelets, boucles d’oreille), elle est aussi revendeuse de miel qu’elle achète auprès des producteurs.
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des paquets de déodorants qu’elle revendra à 1 500 FCFA l’unité.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compté renforcer son épargne pour recevoir durant les cycles à venir un crédit plus important et ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 16, 2011, during the inauguration of their 'banc villageois'. The group is composed of women who all live in the same village. The relations among the group members are characterized by solidarity and mutual assistance. The group members are starting to understand the program better and are very active in small-scale commerce at the village's weekly market.

Ms. Racky (standing first from the left in the photo) is the featured borrower. She is a married mother of two children, a boy and a girl, and she is 28 years old. She sells cosmetic products and clothing accessories (bracelets, earrings), and she also sells honey, which she purchases from producers. 

With her new loan, she is going to purchase packets of deodorants that she resells at 1,500 francs CFA each. With the profits, she plans on bolstering her savings in order to received a bigger loan in future loan cycles, as well as improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase packets of deodorants to resell

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is a 40-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as intelligent. She operates a printing, typesetting and photocopy business where she does printing, photocopying and typesetting. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are all types of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be location. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add a stock of printing and photocopying paper and other items. Her business goal is to have a printing press within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was paid back successfully.

loans.use: to add a stock of printing and photocopying paper and other items.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sofia is 35 years old. She is single and has been dealing in timber for the last 13 years. She started this business because it seemed lucrative. She has borrowed 3,000,000 UGX to buy more timber in preparation for the end of the year when people do a lot of construction. 

Her dream is to complete her own house and stop renting. Her challenge is that the business tariffs are sometimes prohibitive.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg is 51 years old lives with her two daughters and grandson in a rental apartment in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her older daughter is unemployed and stays home. Her younger daughter, Myagmarsuren, is 20, and a sophomore at the local university. Her grandson, Anar, is 8 years old and studies at the local primary school. Uranchimeg started her tailoring service business in 2005. She has built close relationships with her clients and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting a 1,900,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of inventory to meet clients' orders for seasonal traditional costumes and modern clothing. She is a talented, well-experienced and hard-working woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventory to meet clients' orders for seasonal traditional costumes and modern clothing

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a farmer from the town San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. Jocelyn hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of her income.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Abdulfaiz

texts.en:
Abdulfaiz wants a loan to start a business. From childhood, he has been breeding livestock at home for his own consumption. He plans to buy a dairy cow and start selling milk. And then, after a while, he wants to start buying and selling livestock. 

Abdulfaiz lives in Fayzabad, an area famous for cool winds. He is 33 years old, married and has one child.
 
Abdulfaiz grows fruit trees and twice a year he harvests a crop of apples and pears. Abdulfaiz is engaged in selling the fruit wholesale. This activity is the main source of his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start his business

loans.name: Silvana Estefania

texts.es:
Silvana es un joven de 18 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor; asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial se cultiva la uva, el esparrago, el algodón, entre otros. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Silvana solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de cosmeatria.

Día a día Silvana trabaja como ayudante en un puesto de venta de ropa, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día  y puede llegar a atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, Ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es responsable y carismática.

Silvana está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una cocina a gas para su madre ya que actualmente cocina a kerosene, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir esforzándose por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de cosmeatria y poder tener su propio Spa”.
texts.en:
Silvana is an 18 year-old youth who lives in the city of Ica, which is a place  known for its warm and welcoming climate.  She works in agriculture, specifically; she cultivates grapes, asparagus, cotton, and other crops.  Due to a lack of money, Silvana was only able to complete 5 years of secondary school, but she would have liked to have been able to study cosmetology.

Day by day Silvana works as an assistant at a stall, selling clothing.  She works for about 9 hours a day, and she is able to tend to up to 20 customers per day.  She believes that she is getting ahead because she is very friendly to the customers, and most of all, she is responsible and charming.

Silvana is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support, she will be able to buy a gas stove for her mother, who currently cooks with a kerosene stove.  In this way, she will be able to improve her family's quality of life and continue her efforts to make her greatest dream a reality: to study cosmetology and have her own beauty spa.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove

loans.name: Benkadi V Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe BENKADI  V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO, un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec  AWA,1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "BENKADI  V" are married women, who average 35 years of age and four children each, and they all living in polygamous families in KOMO, a village in BAGUINEDA (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is rice, as is the case with AWA, who is the first person standing from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold at the village market to a customer base composed of retailers and consumers. She plans on making a profit of 150,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help her husband to cover the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to purchase farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is the owner of a small farm in Stepanavan, a small city in the Lori region. Arsen is married and has two young sons. His wife does not work outside the home since she takes care of their sons. Arsen is 31 years old and has received a higher education with the specialty of engineer. Now, Arsen is engaged in swine breeding and he has a pig and six piglets. He keeps his farm animals in a barn in front of their house. He breeds and takes care of his animals thoroughly and, as a result, nearby butchers prefer to buy meat from Aesen’s farm. At the same time, Arsen also manages to work his specialty but that, with the income from his farming, barely provides minimum living conditions for his family.
Arsen has decided to expand his livestock and wants to buy several bulls. Arsen asks a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams for that purchase and he hopes very much that this support will give him an opportunity to develop his farming.

loans.use: To buy several bulls

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente is  a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income. Vicente is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm as well as his harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan, 40, is married and has 3 children aged 3, 5, and 7. He deals in milk and also sells goats. He wants this loan to buy more goats for his business. Dan has a dream of building a bigger home. He is a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Mahabbat

texts.en:
Mahabbat is 57 years old, married and has five children. Mahabbat and his wife breed cattle and their livestock currently includes 20 cows and 15 calves. He also owns a plot of agricultural land where he cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes. Although both Mahabbat and his wife are retired, they work really hard to run their farm and get income from it. 
With this loan, Mahabbat wants to purchase a cow as well as fuel for transporting the gathered harvest to the market. The loan is very important for him to be able to continue the expansion of his farm and generate more income. He has already taken five loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan repayment history, he has applied for his sixth loan of 2000 AZN. He waits for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow as well as fuel for transporting the gathered harvest to the market

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot, who lives in Kapan in the Syunik region, has been engaged in vegetable gardening for 30 years. Ashot cultivates beans, tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, eggplant, zucchini, radishes and greens. He knows nearly everything of how to choose and plant different seedlings, the right time to harvest and how to avoid spoiling them. During the year, Ashot sends a large amount of vegetables to the wholesale markets of Kapan. 
Ashot has completed his higher education, graduating from Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute. He is married and he has a very nice wife, who is unemployed now and helps him with the gardening very much. They have two sons and a daughter. Their elder son and daughter are married and live separately with their families and the youngest son is in the military. Ashot asks for a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams to solve a very important problem for him since it causes great losses to his business. He wants to build a concrete fence along his garden because the river near it rises each year and washes away most of his soil.

loans.use: To build a concrete fence along his garden

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
Santa Catalina es un grupo de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está en su ciclo 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas en todos los aspectos de su vida.
Una persona con gran espíritu de lucha y con ganas de salir adelante es la Sra. Silvana, quien gracias a las ventas que hace en su despensa es que está saliendo adelante. Empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero poco a poco fue creciendo y mejorando su tienda.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser carne, verduras, frutas, hortalizas, arroz y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas, y de esa forma también tener los ingresos para seguir creciendo con su tienda.
texts.en:
Santa Catalina is a group in the city of Paraguarí.  It’s in its 12th cycle in the women’s committee program and they are taking the poverty elimination survey to get to know each and every one of their situation in all aspects of their lives.

A person with a great fighting spirit and strong drive to get ahead is Silvana who thanks to her sales in her grocery store is getting ahead.  She started out with a small business which has gradually been growing and the store has been improving.

She’s asking for this loan in order to buy stock merchandise like meat, vegetables, fruit, rice, etc. for her store in order to continue with her sales and in this way to have income to continue growing with the store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Maria Auxiliadora” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de Tacuruty de la ciudad de Santani, son de una zona bastante alejada de la zona céntrica, es de difícil acceso, las integrantes sueñan con que su comunidad vaya mejorando y que el dia de mañana puedan tener mejor acceso, mayor seguridad.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Wilma, quien se dedica a la cría, venta, y faena de animales de corral, donde ella los cuida, alimenta y ve que no les falte nada. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que suena por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Esta ,uy agradecida por esta oportunidad que todas están recibiendo, que les permitirá crecer.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, como ser afrecho, trigo, alfalfa y demás.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” committee came together when several neighbors from the community of Tacuruty in the city of Santani joined together.  They are from a zone that’s quite far from the central zone and it’s difficult to access.  The members dream that their community will gradually improve and that in future access and security will be better.

One of them is Wilma who works raising, selling and butchering barnyard animals.  She cares for them and feeds them there and sees that they lack nothing.  She’s a very hardworking, enterprising woman who dreams with improving her and her family’s living conditions.  She’s very grateful for this opportunity that all of them are getting that will allow them to grow.

She requests this loan to buy feed like bran, wheat, alfalfa and others.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine at wholesale.

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été également crée depuis le 23 Novembre 2011 et regroupe des femmes du même quartier unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.

Madame Seynabou est la représentante, elle âgée de 25 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de deux enfants dont un garçon et une fille tous scolarisés.

Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus divers chaussures et habits prêt à porter.Avec son nouveau crédit de

500000 francs CFA elle va acheter des tissus à 200000 des perruques et mèches à 100000 ,des chaussures à 100000. 

et des habits prêt à porter à 100000 .Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine .

Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge ses parents et de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group, also created on November 23, 2011, gathers women from the same neighborhood who are united by good social and professional relationships.

The group's representative, Seynabou, is 25 years old.  She is divorced and the mother of two children (one boy and one girl) who both attend school.

Seynabou is actively involved in retail: she sells various fabrics, shoes and ready-to-wear clothing.  With her new loan of 500,000 CFA francs, she will buy fabrics for 200,000 francs, wigs and hair extensions for 100,000 francs, shoes for 100,000 francs and ready-to-wear clothing for 100,000 francs.  She has a good experience in her field.

With her profits, she is able to take care of her parents and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, shoes, wigs, hair extensions and clothes for retail sale.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a married man, age 43, with four children who all attend school. 
He is a cattle trader and sells milk on a daily basis at a nearby trading center, although at times he takes the milk to the city. He says he works seven days a week. 
Sam also has a banana plantation that helps feed his family and generates some income at the end of the month. 
He started this business in the year 1990 and he says he has been able to pay his children's tuition and meet his daily needs through this business.
He says the need to take care of his family prompted him to start this business which has been successful. He says that his main clients are fellow cattle traders and families around his area. With the loan, he will be able to buy cows at a cheap price since it is a dry season when people have no water and are selling cheaply. He will be able to sell later in the year at a high price.
His main challenges are cattle diseases that lead to quarantines and droughts that result in low milk production. He is a hard-working and resilient man.

loans.use: To buy cattle for trade

loans.name: Sarafeen

texts.en: Sarafeen is a 51-year-old married woman who has been in the business of milk sales for many years. She has two buffaloes to milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She is a mother of five children and is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of living. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business through Kashf's support. Now, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano tiene 48 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que tenia 10 años de edad, prácticamente a trabajado toda su vida en este rubro; donde fue su papá el mejor tutor que él ha conocido porque le enseño todo lo que sabe y lo desempeña de una forma muy propia y ordenada, gracias a lo que le enseño su papá fue como salio adelante con su compañera de vida y su hijo, ademas en ocasiones lo buscan para ayudante de albañil y obtiene una fuente de ingreso mas a parte de la agricultura.
       
Los insumos que utiliza para  la siembra de maíz como fertilizantes y herbicidas, los adquiere en la cabecera departamental. El tiempo que tarda en autobús en llegar a la entrada del cantón es de 30 minutos,y desde la entrada le toca cargar en la espalda los insumos hasta su casa.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 2 sacos de abono, 4 litros de herbicida. Se le estará apoyando para que pueda comprar los insumos que necesitara para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y pueda tener su cultivo en buenas condiciones y con un manejo mas adecuado.


Su deseo es, remodelar su casa para que sus futuros hijos y herederos puedan tener mejores condiciones de vida que las que tuvo él.
texts.en:
Luciano, 48, has a spouse and a son.  He has made a living in agriculture since he was 10; he has worked in this field practically his whole life.  His father was the best teacher he has known because he taught him everything he knows and he does it in a correct and orderly fashion.  Thanks to what his father taught him he got ahead with his life partner and his son.  Also, sometimes he's hired as a construction assistant and he has another source of income besides agriculture.

He gets the fertilizer and herbicide he needs for his corn crops in the departmental capital.  It takes him 30 minutes to get to the canton entrance, from where he has to carry the inputs on his back to his house.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two sacks of soil amendments and four liters of herbicide.  This will help him buy the inputs he needs to grow 7,000 square meters of corn and have his crop in good condition with more suitable management.

He wants to remodel his house so his future children and heirs can have better living conditions than he had.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and herbicide

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en: Rasheeda runs a grocery business that is adjacent to her home. She sells different grocery items like ghee, cooking oils, salt, etc. at very reasonable rates. Her husband is employed and her son is studying in class 4th. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her grocery shop, as she is out of stock these days. With the loan investment she will put larger quantities of grocery items in her shop. This will allow her to fulfill her customers' orders on time and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of three children. Alejandro has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. Alejandro is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Alejandro hopes to make his farm a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Amada

texts.en: Amada is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Amada has been in the farming business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income. Amada is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita insumos agricolas, porque se acerca la temporada para la siembra, con los fondos prestados comprara abono, foliares e insecticidas, esto le ayudara para empezar con la siembra. 
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, incrementando sus ganancias y con los gastos básicos del hogar, considera que la inversión ha mejorado su situación económica, encontrándose muy bien de salud con su familia.
texts.en: Mario has decided to apply for another loan to pay for agricultural supplies, which he needs now the time for sowing seeds is approaching. With the funds he borrows he will buy fertilisers and insecticides, which will help him when he starts sowing. The positive effect his last loan had allowed him to increase his earnings and pay for basic household expenses. He feels that the loan enabled him to better his economic situation, and he and his family now find themselves in very good health.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and insecticides.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 30 años, esta casada y tiene una hija con quien vive en su casa propia. Flor se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, comenta que no cuenta con un horno propio por lo que tiene que alquilar uno, “ya estoy ahorrando para poder construir mi propia fábrica”, afirma. Es así que ahora espera con muchas ansias poder incrementar su producción de 3 millares semanales a 6 millares, esta meta lo obtendrá con mayor capital de trabajo y con personal que contratará, pues el esfuerzo que realiza su esposo y ella no basta para cubrir los pedidos que diariamente tiene.Este es su primer crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Flor, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles la compra de materiales como madera, yeso y demás productos que sirven para al elaboración de los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Flor, 30 years old, is married and has a daughter with whom she lives in her own house.  Flor makes a living manufacturing bricks.  She says that she doesn’t have her own oven and therefore she has to rent one.  “I am already saving to be able to build my own brickworks,” she says.  That's why she now eagerly hopes to be able to increase her production of 3 thousand a week to 6 thousand.  She will obtain this goal with greater working capital and with personnel that she will hire since the efforts that she and her husband make are not enough to cover the orders that she has daily.  

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to move forward.  She is also committed to paying her installments in a timely manner.  Flor will invest the 1,000 soles (PEN) in the purchase of materials like wood, plaster and other products that are used in the manufacture of bricks.

loans.use: to purchase wood, plaster and other products for the manufacture of bricks.

loans.name: Karen Yessenia

texts.es:
Karen es una joven de 19 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de imperial. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto de secundaria ya que tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a su familia. Día a día Karen trabaja como mesera en una pollería de su ciudad, Karen cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de progresar.

Karen esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracia a la ayuda que le ha brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para el armado de jaulas( alambres), ya que ha iniciado su negocio de venta y crianza de patos ,de esta manera podrá tener un ingreso extra y seguir esforzándose por poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Apoyar a su familia y tener una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Karen is a young 19-year-old living in the city of Imperial.  Because of her limited economic resources she was only able to complete fifth grade of secondary school because she had to go to work to support her family.  Day to day Karen works as a waitress in a chicken shop in her city.  Karen believes she’s getting ahead because she’s very responsible and above all because she very much wants to make progress.

Karen’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy supplies needed to make cages (wire) because she’s started a business raising and selling ducks.  In this way, she’ll have extra income and will be able to continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to support her family and have a university career.

loans.use: to buy wire.

loans.name: Santa Eleuteria

texts.es:
Santa vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, es una ciudad en la cual se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, entre otros. Santa es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde joven aprendió lo que es ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres eran muy humildes. Santa se esfuerza mucho cada día, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de comida el cual logro tener con mucho ahorro y sobre todo esfuerzo, cada día Santa le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene muy buen sazón.

Santa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un pequeño toldo para su negocio y así poder brindar comodidad a sus clientes ya que podrá cubrirlos del sol, de esta manera sus ingresos mejoraran y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Santa lives in the city of Ica, which has a very hot and pleasant climate. Agriculture plays a big part in the city's development, particularly the cultivation of grapes and asparagus. Santa is a very hardworking woman; as her parents were very poor, she has known since she was a little girl what it is like to work hard to put bread on the table. Santa works every day in a small food shop, which she fought hard to save up to buy. She works for around 9 hours and serves up to 10 customers a day. She believes that business is going well for her because she is friendly with her customers and above all because her food tastes good. 

Santa is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy a small awning for her shop, providing a more comfortable environment for her customers by giving them some shade. This will increase her profits and means that she will be able to continue working towards making her dream of owning a big restaurant a reality.

loans.use: To buy an awning.

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
El joven Milciades optó seguir la carrera de Zootecnia. Viene de una familia muy trabajadora, desde muy pequeño trabajo en un Supermercado, en donde hoy día es cajero. Su aspiración se enfoca en el interés que tiene para trabajar con los animales y sobre cómo sacar provecho de los mismos, no es fácil para el trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo, pero según comenta gracias al acompañamiento de su familia saca fuerzas de donde sea para no rendirse y alcanzar sus sueños.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de la universidad, y también poder cubrir sus cuotas para seguir estudiando y dedicándose.
texts.en:
Young Milciades has chosen to pursue a degree in Zoology. He comes from a very hardworking family. From a young age, he has worked at a supermarket where he is currently employed as a cashier. His inspiration comes from his interest in working with animals, so he would like to take advantage of this hobby. It is not easy for him to work and study at the same time, but Milciades says that he draws strength from his family since they encourage him to reach for his dreams and to never give up.

He is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his university expenses. Milciades will also cover his tuition payments so that he can continue studying in pursuit of his career.

loans.use: to pay his tuition and university expenses.

loans.name: Yacine's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 16 mai  2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte femmes qui habitent toutes le même village, solidarité et entre aide caractérisent les relations entre membre du groupe. Elles commencent à mieux comprendre le programme et sont très actives dans le petit commerce au niveau du marché hebdomadaire du village.

Madame Yacine (assise l’extrême gauche avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 03 filles. Elle tient une gargote où elle sert le petit déjeuner le matin. De même elle est revendeuse d’huile de palm qu’elle achète auprès des producteurs pour la revente par bouteille d’un litre.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte acheter un carton de spaghetti, un sac d’ognon, un bidon de 05 litres d’huile raffiné et des assaisonnements pour la préparation des mets.


Les bénéfices lui serviront d’apporter son soutien à ses enfants en âges de scolarisation, en plus de satisfaire leur besoins primaires
texts.en:
This group, created on May 16, 2011 at the inauguration of the banc villageois, gathers women who all live in the same village.  The relationships between the members of the group are characterized by strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance.  The women from this group are also starting to become familiar with the loan program and are actively involved in small retail business at the village's weekly market.

Yacine, seated at the far left in the photo and raising her hand, is the featured borrower.  She is married and the mother of eight children, including three girls.  She runs a small restaurant in which she serves breakfast in the morning.  She also resells palm oil which she buys from producers and resells in 1-liter bottles, on a retail basis.

She plans to use her new loan to buy one box of spaghetti, one bag of onions, one 5-liter can of refined oil and some seasonings to prepare her dishes.

With her profits, she will contribute to the educational needs of her school-aged children and take care of their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy one box of spaghetti, one bag of onions, one 5-liter can of refined oil, as well as seasonings for cooking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Mama Bousso's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été crée le 28 Mars 1995. Il est composé de femmes habitant le même village et entretenant de bonnes relations et généralement exercent toutes le commerce et l'embouche. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la représentante, Mama est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 04 enfants toutes filles. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter 02 sacs de sucre de 50 kgs à 29 000 frs l'unité. Elle revend le kg à 650 frs. 

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité lui permettent d'entretenir sa famille et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This group is part of the Banc Villageois created on March 28, 1995.  It comprises women who live in the same village and are united by good relationships.  They are generally all involved in commerce or livestock fattening.

Mama, the group's representative, is standing on the right-hand side of the photo and raising her hand.  She is 39 years old, divorced, and the mother of four children, all girls.

She will use her loan to buy two bags of sugar, each weighing 50 kilos and costing 29,000 francs.  She resells sugar at a price of 650 francs per kilo.

The profits from her business allow her to take care of her family's needs and to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar for retail sale.

loans.name: Las Del Río  ( Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las del Rio, está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, lugar rodeado de hermosos paisajes, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su gente es muy amable y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su actividad económica es la agricultura, la crianza de animales y la elaboración de sogas, algunos salen a la ciudad a trabajar en diferentes actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Rosario, se encuentra en este grupo desde hace 3 años le gusta esta estar con sus amigas y a la vez es una manera rápida de obtener capital para su negocio.

Ella tiene 42 años, es casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 10 hijos, uno de ellos es  casado y vive independiente, uno de sus hijos trabaja y le ayuda económicamente,  uno  estudia en la universidad,  tres están en el colegio, tres en la escuela y su último hijo aun pasa en casa. Su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña María Rosario se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y tiene un invernadero de tomates, también cría gallinas, cerdos, cuyes y ganado. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en abono, en semillas de tomate y alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es agrandar más su invernadero. 

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Las del Río” (The Ones from the River) group consists of 8 women who live around Jadan Parish in Cuenca, a place surrounded by beautiful scenery with an architecture that blends the ancient with the modern; its residents are very gracious and still retain the culture and traditions of their peoples.  Their economic activity is agriculture, animal husbandry, rope making and some of them go into the city to work in various jobs.

One of this group’s members is María Rosario.  She’s been in this group for three years and likes being with her girlfriends while at the same time it’s a quick way of getting capital for her business.

She is 42-years-old, married and has conceived ten children.  One of them is married and lives independently, one of her sons is employed and helps her economically, one is attending university, three are in secondary school, three in primary school and her youngest son still stays at home.   Her husband works as a day laborer and they own their house.

María Rosario works in agriculture growing vegetables and she has a tomato nursery; she also raises chickens, pigs, guinea pigs and cattle.

She will use her new loan to buy manure, tomato seeds and animal feed.  Her goal is to enlarge the nursery.

The small inserted photo is of a member who was unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Oscar Harold

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven de 27 años, que debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas. 

Por la noches Oscar trabaja como personal de seguridad, hasta tempranas horas del día, pero también ha iniciado con mucho esfuerzo su pequeño negocio de venta de conejos, con lo cual tiene un dinerito extra para apoyar con los gastos del hogar; el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo muy responsable.

Oscar esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales como alambres, caña de Guayaquil, entre otros,  para poder construir unos corrales para la crianza de conejos,  ya que estos materiales no maltratan a los animalitos y de esta manera los puede criar de mejor manera, así el podrá seguir mejorando con su negocio y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una gran granja y poder estudiar la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas”.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young man of 27 years, who, owing to the limited financial resources of his parents was only able to study until the end of secondary school, although he wanted to study to be a systems engineer. 

At night, Oscar works as a security guard until the early hours of the morning. He has also put a lot of effort into beginning his business selling rabbits, which gives him some extra money for household expenses. He believes he will be successful because he has a good relationship with his customers and above all is very responsible. 

Oscar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, he will be able to buy materials like wire and Guayaquil bamboo, among others, in order to build some pens for the breeding of his rabbits. He chose these materials because they do not harm the small animals, and this way he can raise them better. This will allow him to keep improving his business and himself, so that he will be able to realize his greatest dream: "to have a great farm and to be able to study to be a systems engineer."

loans.use: to buy materials to build rabbit pens.

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq is 34 years old and a married man with 2 children. Seven years ago, he opened a food store in his home because he needed to take care of his children. That is how he started his business. Currently, he enjoys running the business because he likes interacting with his customers. Sadiq also bought a refrigerator to begin selling cold drinks, such as soda pop, which are in high demand because he lives in a tropical zone. Every morning he opens his business very early and offers his customers products such as rice, sugar, cereal, canned goods, and noodles.

One of Sadiq's principal long-term goals is to improve his dwelling and build it with bricks and cement in order to improve his store.  He will use the loan of 1800 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to purchase merchandise for his business, such as rice, sugar, cereals, soft drinks, and candy. This is his sixth loan with Kiva, and he is committed to making his payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his business, such as rice, sugar, cereals, soft drinks, and candy.

loans.name: Soda's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composer de 6 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et font toutes le commerce.Il est à son 10éme prêt. Soda est la représentante du groupe, elle est âgé de 46 ans, marié et mère de 11 enfants dont 2 garçons et 9 filles. ils on ente 29 et 6 ans. elle fait du commerce de produits halieutique et fait en même temps de la couture.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter une machine à coudre à 150000f et 250000f de produits halieutiques. Elle vend ses produits dans le marché du poisson de la ville.Elle a une expérience de plus de 30 ans. Avec ses bénéfices elle satisfaits les besoins de ses enfants et épargne dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group is made up of six women who live in the same neighborhood and are all involved in retail business.  This is their tenth loan.

Soda is the group's representative.  She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of 11 children, including two boys and nine girls.  Her children's ages range between 29 and 6 years old.  

Soda sells fish-related goods and also works as a seamstress.  She plans to use her loan to buy a sewing machine for 150,000 francs and fish-related products for 250,000 francs.  She resells her goods at her city's fish market.  She has more than 30 years of experience in her field.

She uses her profits to meet the needs of her children and to strengthen her savings within the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and some fish-related products.

loans.name: Laura Marcela

texts.es: Laura Marcela es una mujer de 22 años de edad, es soltera y aún no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo y mercancía en general, como ropa, accesorios, entre otros; actividad que realiza desde el año 2009, con la cual ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar económicamente a su familia y además le permitió cumplir uno de sus sueños que era graduarse como Técnica Auxiliar en Salud Oral. Laura es una persona emprendedora, con habilidad comercial intuitiva y espíritu de superación; para generar mayores utilidades ella aprovecha las promociones internas que sacan en los catálogos y luego vende la mercancía al precio estipulado para el público general. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea comprar más mercancía (cremas corporales, perfumes, bisutería, productos de aseo, cosméticos) y una vitrina que requiere para exhibir los productos; de esta forma podrá ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, incrementar sus ventas y por ende aumentar el nivel de ingresos. Su principal sueño es hacer carrera en el área de las ventas y desea aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presenta con la venta de productos por catálogo, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Laura Marcela is a 22-year-old woman who is single and has no children. She currently sells catalog products and general merchandise such as clothing, accessories, and other items. Laura has been doing this type of work since 2009 and it has allowed her to earn income to support her family financially. This also allowed her to fulfill one of her dreams, which was to graduate as a Certified Dental Assistant.

Laura is an enterprising person who has a natural instinct for business and the drive to succeed. In order to generate more profit, she takes advantage of internal promotions offered through the catalogs and then sells the merchandise to the general public at a stated price. With the loan she is requesting from Interactuar, Laura will buy more merchandise such as body crèmes, perfumes, trinkets, toiletries, and cosmetics, as well as a display cabinet that she needs to exhibit her products. As a result, she will be able to offer a greater variety to her customers, increase her sales, and eventually raise her income level. Her main goal is to establish a career in sales, so she wants to take advantage of this current opportunity of selling catalog products in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a display cabinet for exhibiting her products.

loans.name: Fatama

texts.en:
Fatama lives and works in St. Paul, which is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing.

Fatama is 28 years old and is single with two children, ages 8 and 3; the children are in school and live at home. For the past 7 years, Fatama has been operating a table where she sells fish. She says sometimes the buying goes slowly. She started this business by selling around in the communities with the few goods she could afford, a method she learned from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
Nueva Estrella esta en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas tienen la esperanza de mejorar sus vidas por medio del programa de comités. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Patrocinia es una mujer que trabaja mucho, ella se dedica a la costura, y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos. Ella es muy hábil con lo que hace y es por eso que sus clientes siempre vuelven a ella y le traen mas trabajo. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y el día de mañana tener mas maquinas y poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Agradece por esta oportunidad y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo y luchando por crecer así según sus deseos.
texts.en:
“Nueva Estrella” (New Star) is in its cycle #1 in the women’s committee program where they all hope to improve their lives by means of the committee program.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and ten of them are below the poverty line, that is to say very low income.

Patrocinia’s a woman who works much.  She sews and says she has a good clientele because they always place many orders.  She’s very skilled in what she does and this is why her customers return to her and bring her more work.  Her goal is to continue growing so that in future to have more machines and be able to provide employment for others.

She is grateful for this opportunity and requests this loan in order to buy fabric and thread and other supplies to continue with her work and striving to grow according to her wishes.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Jenny Lizbeth

texts.es:
Jenny es una joven de 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, al lado de sus padres a quienes quiere muchísimo y sobre todo cada día se esfuerza por  salir adelante cada día para poder  ser un orgullo para ellos.  Con mucha dedicación Jeny se encuentra estudiando la carrera de enfermería y para poder solventar algunos gastos de sus estudios Jenny tiene su pequeño negocio de ropa, ella atiende alrededor de 10 personas al día ya y le dedica alrededor de 3 horas ya que acude a su centro de estudios; ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable.

Jeny está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar algunos materiales para poder refaccionar el cuarto donde habita, con lo cual podrá tener un mejor ambiente donde vivir y podra seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y poder tener un gran negocio”.
texts.en:
Jenny is a young woman who is 22 years old. She lives next to her parents, who she loves a lot, in the city of Ica. Primarily, she strives to get ahead every day so she can be their pride and joy. With much dedication, Jenny is studying nursing. To cover some of her education expenses, Jenny has a small clothing business. She serves around 10 people a day already and devotes about 3 hours, since she goes to school. She believes she is getting ahead because she is very responsible. 

Jenny is very grateful for Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help that they will have given her, she will be able to buy some materials to renovate her room. With this, she will have a better environment to live in and she will be able to keep fighting to make her dreams come true. Her biggest dream is to be a great professional and to have a great business.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her room.

loans.name: De La Paz

texts.es:
De la Paz es una estudiante sacrificada de la ciudad de Ybycui, está siguiendo la carrera de Administración de empresas, la cual le gusta mucho y por la que se esta esmerando mucho.
Ella tiene como meta poder ser una gran profesional que sea útil a las demás personas y también a su familia, ya que ellos siempre han estado al lado de ella apoyándola en sus metas y anhelos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en útiles para su universidad, como así también otros gastos que surjan en su vida de universitaria. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
De La Paz is a self-sacrificing student from the city of Ybycui. She is pursuing a degree in Business Administration because she enjoys this field and takes a great interest. Her goal is to become a successful professional so that she will be of use to other people and also to her family. They have been by her side, supporting her in her goals and ambitions.

De La Paz is requesting this loan so that she can invest in supplies for her university studies, as well as other expenses that are related to being a college student. She appreciates the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her university studies and to pay for a few other expenses.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 33 year-old married father of two children. He owns a farm where he rears cattle and different kinds of birds. He makes his revenue by selling cow milk and chicken eggs. His wife is unemployed, and both his children are still in school.

Hussein's income is insufficient to provide a healthy life for his family, especially since schooling expenses are costly. As a result, Hussein contacted Al Majmoua to acquire a loan and purchase more cattle, which would greatly increase his output and thus also increase his revenue. As for the future, Hussein wishes to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle, which would greatly increase his output

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Blas  está en el 10° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante desde el año 2008, es decir que este ya es un grupo bien formado y donde toda ya se conocen muy bien.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, quien día tras día se esfuerza por poder crecer. Ella tiene las esperanzas puestas en que por medio del programa de comité podrá seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia, que es su principal motor. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, y cuenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, y que poco a poco está creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en cargar con mas productos su negocio, como ser: frutas, verduras, hortalizas, productos a granel y demás. Ella quiere que conforme pase el tiempo todas sigan mejorando sus vidas.
texts.en:
The “San Blas” group is in its 10th cycle in the women’s committee program where they’ve all worked and helped each other out since 2008, that is to say this is a well-established group where they all know each other very well.

One of the members is Sonia who day to day strives to be able to grow.  She hopes that by means of the committee program she’ll be able to continue to grow and to help her family which is her main motivator.  She has a well-stocked store and she relates that she started out with a small business that’s been gradually growing thanks to her effort.

She requests this loan to be able to stock more merchandise like fruit, vegetables, bulk items, etc. in her store.  She wants that as time goes by all of their lives will continue to improve.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 7 femmes qui son unies par de bonnes relations sociales et font toutes le commerce. Astou est la représentante du groupe ,elle est âgée de 61 ans , mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons et 3 filles qui ont entre 30 et 15 ans.Elle fait du commerce de produits halieutiques.Elle part dans la ville côtière la plus proche  pour acheter ses produits et vient au marché pour exposé. Elle fait cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le banc villageois( 5 ans). Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 200kg de poisson fumé à 50000f ;100kg de poisson séché à 100000f et 80 k de cymbium a 104000f.Avec ses bénéfices elle aide ses enfants dans les dépenses de la maison .
texts.en:
This group consists of seven women who are united by good social relationships and all work in retail.

Astou is the group's representative.  She is 61 years old, married, and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls) whose ages range between 30 and 15 years old.  

Astou sells seafood.  She goes to the nearest coastal town to buy her goods and resells at the market.  She has been involved in this activity since she joined the banc villageois five years ago.

She plans to use her loan to buy 200 kilos of smoked fish at a total price of 50,000 francs, 100 kilos of dry fish at 100,000 francs and 80 kilos of cymbium (a type of sea snail) at 104,000 francs.

She uses her profits to help her children cover their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy smoked and dry fish, as well as sea snails (cymbium).

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy lives in Cibubur, about one hour from Jakarta. Rudy manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit. Rudy is married and living with five persons in the family home.  

Rudy joined Ruma two years ago because he wanted to expand his mobile airtime business. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Rudy sees improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he has earned an average of $37–$40/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel the bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas se formo con la unión de 21 amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, el grupo está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 15 mujeres mostraron tener un ingreso muy bajo, pero son conscientes que deben de seguir trabajando y no desanimarse.
Modesta vende productos Avon, y cuenta que por medio de sus ventas está saliendo adelante y luchando por su familia, para poder darles lo mínimo que puedan necesitar. Ella sabe que la única forma de salir adelante es trabajar, y es por eso que se está esforzando el doble. Quiere poder tener algún día su propio negocio independiente en su casa.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de productos Avon, para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, agradece por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo todas.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) formed when 21 girlfriends and neighbors from the city of San Lorenzo came together.  The group is in cycle #9 in the women’s committee program.  They are filling out the poverty elimination survey and 15 of them are of very low income but aware that they must continue working and not become discouraged.

Modesta sells Avon products and relates that she’s getting ahead and fighting for her family in order to provide for their minimum needs by means of her sales.  She knows that the only way to get ahead is by working and this is why she’s putting in double effort.  She wants someday to be able to have her own independent businesss at home.

She requests this loan to buy Avon products to fill pending customer orders; she’s grateful for the opportunity all of them are getting.

loans.use: To buy Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Handini

texts.en:
Handini runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about one hour from Jakarta. Handini is married and lives with four persons in the family home. 

Handini began working with Ruma one and a half years ago because she wanted to try a mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $51-$55/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Yayan

texts.en:
Yayan lives in Serang, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Yayan is married and living with three persons in the family home.  

Yayan joined Ruma two months ago because he wanted to expand his mobile airtime business. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Yayan sees improvements in his shop. For the last two months, he has earned an average of $47–$50/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Yadi

texts.en:
Yadi runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Serang, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Yadi is married and lives with three persons in the family home. 

Yadi began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to get more income. He feels really excited to expand his business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last two months, he has had around $36–$40/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a single man. He describes himself as credible. He operates a clothing store where he sells trousers, shirts, dresses etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a profitable area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as poor infrastructure, which leads to high transport costs. He will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy materials for making clothes, such as thread and a sewing machine. His business goal is to become the leading dealer of clothes within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self-reliant.

loans.use: buy materials for making clothes, such as thread and a sewing machine

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 38-year-old single man living in a village in the Bekaa valley. He owns a small garage where he maintains and paints cars. His income is barely sufficient to provide for one person, which is why he needs to enhance his business if he wishes to settle down and build a family. 

He has contacted Al Majmoua and requested a loan that would help him achieve his wishes. In fact, this loan would enable him to buy a new work kit that would be up-to-date with the new technologies on the market. 

As for the future, Ismail hopes to boost his business by expanding the garage.

loans.use: to buy a new work kit that would be up-to- date with the new technologies on the market.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka runs a small stall which sells drinking water and mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Serang, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Eka is married and lives with three persons in the family home. 

Eka began working with Ruma two months ago because she wanted to try a mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last two months, she has had around $46-$50/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Minas

texts.en:
Minas is 42 years old and lives with his nice family in the village of Tsovagyugh, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Minas has two sweet daughters. His wife does not work since she takes care of both their children and their cute farm. Minas has a vocational education with the specialty of machinist, but he has never worked in his specialty. For several years, he has worked as a builder, and he has been engaged in farming and agriculture for twenty years. The farm he has today has been developed through hard work, days and nights, and through his purposefulness and stubbornness in wanting to provide a better future for his family. His farm has seven cows, four calves, ten sheep, and eighteen chickens. He also cultivates beans, tomatoes, cucumbers, and greens. Minas manages to hand the milk of his farm cows over to a big dairy-products factory that is very famous in Armenia. He also sells meat to the local butchers, who are very satisfied with the quality of his farm products.

Minas is asking for a loan to buy a hay-mowing machine as cutting the hay manually is very hard and just a waste of time.

loans.use: To buy a hay-mowing machine

loans.name: Aby's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 7 femmes qui font toutes le commerce et ont une bonne cohésion sociale, il est a son 10éme prêt. Aby est la représentante du groupe ,elle est âgée de 53 ans marié et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 garçons et 2 filles qui ont entre 35 et 20 ans.Elle fait du commerce de tissu et de cosmétique.elle part dans un pays frontalier pour acheter sa marchandises et vient exposer sur la route devant la boutique de sa sœur.Elle s’en sorte très bien car l'emplacement de son activité est très fréquenté.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 300000f de tissu et 200000f de produit cosmétique a savoir parfum, gel de bain et crème de corps.Avec ses bénéfices elle aide ses enfants dans leur besoins ,elle épargne aussi dans le banc villageois et aide son marie dans les dépenses de la maison.
texts.en:
This group is made up of seven women who all work in retail and are united by good social relationships.  This is their tenth loan.

Aby is the group's representative.  She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of four children (two boys and two girls) whose ages range between 35 and 20 years old.  

She sells fabrics and beauty products.  She travels to a neighboring country to buy her goods and then resells along a road, in front of her sister's shop.  Her business is doing very well because the location where she sells her products is a very busy one.

With her loan, she plans to spend 300,000 francs to buy fabrics and 200,000 francs to buy beauty products (perfumes, shower gels and body lotions).

With her profits, she supports her children, helps her husband cover the household's expenses, and saves some money within the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and beauty products (perfumes, body lotion and shower gel).

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo is a 59-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 6 grown children. He engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish to earn a living. He has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years. In order to continue his fishing livelihood, he requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets. In the future, Alfredo would like to expand his fishing business to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Please meet 43-year-old Ophelia from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Ophelia is a widow who completed 10th grade. She has two children, aged 23 and 20, who live at home.

For the past ten years, Ophelia has been operating a small table where she sells items such as flour, sugar, onions, and oil. She started this business by selling for a friend and learned this method of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, onions, oil, etc. for her business. She cites fewer goods on her table as her biggest challenge. Her favorite thing about her business is that it makes her independent. In the future, she would like to own a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, onions, oil, etc, for her business.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 60 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene 6 hijos. Vive con sus 6 hijos. Actualmente, se dedica a la agricultura, y el comercio. Desde hace 30 años llevaba la comida hasta el lugar donde trabajaba su papá y fue de esa manera que aprendió a trabajar viendo como era el manejo que se le daba al cultivo, además se dedica a comercializar productos como reliquias y venta de verduras en el mercado, hace 15 años felicitas observaba que su hermana vendía cacaricos(pez) en el mercado, fue en ese entonces donde le nació la idea de comprar cerdos, engordarlos y venderlos, luego que fue creciendo puso una venta de reliquias y una venta de verduras que actualmente posee.

Los insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, herbicidas e insecticidas los compra en la ciudad. Felicitas traslada los insumos en el autobús haciendo un tiempo promedio hasta la entrada del caserío de 30 minutos y desde ahí los tiene que trasladar su compañero de vida con sus hijos cargando en la espalda los sacos de fertilizante.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 quintales de fertilizante, 4 litros de herbicidas, un bote de insecticida y otra parte lo invertirá en la compra de verduras como por ejemplo 2 sacos de ejote, 1 caja de tomates, y 1 saco de cebolla. 

Se le apoyara con el crédito para que pueda comprar los insumos que va a necesitar para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y así tener el cultivo en buenas condiciones para una mejor y mayor producción de granos básicos, además invertirá un poco más en el pequeño puesto de venta de verduras que tiene en el mercado.

Además, mejorará su alimentación ya que se le apoyara para la compra de insumos agrícolas y así pueda trabajar la agricultura junto con su compañero de vida y obtener los granos básicos para la alimentación de sus hijos. Y también tener un ingreso mayor de la venta de verduras que tiene y así ir cubriendo las necesidades de sus hijos.

Ella quiere remodelar su casa para tener una casa más bonita y vivir en mejores condiciones de vida, además quiere continuar cultivando la tierra como lo ha hecho desde hace mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 60, has a spouse and six children.  She lives with her six children and currently works in agriculture and in commerce.  Thirty years ago she’d take her father his lunch to the place where he was working and this is how she learned how working the crops was done; she also worked selling relics and vegetables in the market.  Fifteen years ago she watched her sister selling fish in the market and that’s when she got the idea of buying pigs, fattening them up and selling them.  She gradually grew and then started selling relics and vegetables, the business she currently has.

She buys the supplies like fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide in the city.  She transports the supplies by bus and the trip to the entrance of her settlement takes on average 30 minutes.  From there her life companion and her sons have to transport them carrying the sacks of fertilizer on their backs.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy four quintals of fertilizer, four liters of herbicide and one can of insecticide; she will use the rest to buy vegetables like for example 2 sacks of green beans, one box of tomatoes and one sack of onions.

She will be supported with the loan so that she can buy the supplies she will need to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn so that she can keep her crop in good condition for better and more abundant basic grins production; she will also invest a bit more in her small vegetable stand she has in the market.

Also, she will improve her nutrition because she will be helped to buy agricultural supplies so she and her spouse can work in agriculture and get the basic grains needed for their children’s food while also earning higher income from the sale of vegetables and thus be able to cover their children’s needs.

She wants to remodel her house so that it will be prettier and to live in better conditions; she also wants to continue cultivating the land like she’s been doing for a very long time.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Simon Honorato

texts.es:
Simon tiene 59 años de edad pero tiene una vitalidad y una alegría de un joven de 15 según nos comenta y es porque para él si se deja ganar por el mal humor no va a trabajar bien y sobre todo no podrá estar bien para su familia, vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano derecha y sobre todo su amiga y el hombro en el cual él se puede recostar cuando necesita de un apoyo; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camaná, esta se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, y se le denomina la tierra del sol eterno,  se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, frejol, entre otros. El tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser ingeniero agrónomo.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo el deseo de Salir adelante Simon trabaja en su parcela en la cual cosecha frejol; el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día, sobre todo porque siempre vela porque a sus plantas le de ninguna plaga para que su cosecha sea buena; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y muy conocido por los clientes.

Simon está muy feliz y agradecido por la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar insumos, fertilizantes y abono para su plantas y así poder mejorar la cosecha para el otro año y mejorar su ingreso, de esta manera el podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material Noble”.
texts.en:
Simón is 59-year-old but has the vitality and joy of a young 15-year-old according to what he says.  And that’s because he believes that if he lets a bad mood take over he won’t work well and above all won’t be able to be good for him family.  He lives with his wife who is his right hand and above all his friend and the shoulder on which he can rest when he needs support.  His house is located in the city of Camaná which is noted for its hot weather all year round, it’s called “Land of Eternal Sun.”  Agriculture, especially growing rice and beans, among others, is common.  He attended secondary school but would have liked to have studied Agronomy.

With much effort and above all the wish to get ahead, Simon works his land growing broad beans.  He spends about 10 hours daily at work above all because he’s careful to keep his plants free from pests so that harvest will be good.  He believes he does well in his business because he’s very dedicated and well-known by his customers.

Simón is very happy and grateful for the support Kiva lenders are providing because thanks to their help he will be able to buy supplies like fertilizer and manure for his plants to improve harvest for next year and improve his income.  In this way he will be able to continue striving every day to make his greatest dream reality: to finish building his house out of substantial materials.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer, among others.

loans.name: Eugenia Maria

texts.es: DOÑA EUGENIA DE 48 AÑOS ES HABITANTE DE UNA COMUNIDAD RURAL UBICADA EN EL MUNICIPIO DE EL VIEJO CHINANDEGA. ACTUALMENTE TRABAJA COMO APOYO EN EL CENTRO DE SALUD DE LA COMUNIDAD.
